15111222.content:
A strong clawed hand hoists you back onto your feet. You look at the bear as she mulls over all of her options in her head. A low rumble emerges from her belly. "Y'know, I haven't eaten anything yet today..." Your eyes nearly bulge out of your skull at the mere suggestion. You were not sticking around to discover how that was going to end. Without thinking you run off. She could've played all the painful and humiliating games she wanted, but eating you is a step too far. You hear a condescending voice behind you.

"Ooooh, great idea. I love my prey running for their life." It was followed by an enthusiastic growl and heavy footsteps. A feral bear could outrun you with ease, but this was an alien bear woman. All bets were off but it's probably best not to take any chances. Your best chance lies in trying to evade her in the maze of a building you rushing towards. It looked a bit like an office, most likely were all the boring administrative stuff happened. That probably meant no animals would be holed up there. The bear's rapid breath and heavy footsteps behind you spurred you on to your target. Once inside you quickly duck through several corners. You hear the heavy steps slow down as she tries to find you. With a moment of freedom you plot your next few moves. How successful was your escape attempt?
15111222.title: She wants to eat but you run from her, will she...

151112222.content: How does she manage to catch you?
151112222.title: The bear catches you.

1511122222.content: Those damn aliens and their technology! What gadget does the bear woman use to catch you?
1511122222.title: with alien trickery

choices: more fun with the cloaking device.
15111222221.content:
You silently scurry through the abandoned building. The bear woman could be anywhere. You hadn't heard her heavy footsteps in a while, which was encouraging. The sudden crack of thunder startled you. Rain followed soon after, the sound of it hitting the roof was calming to you. You kept on sneaking for an exit. This rain was an ideal way to shake her off for good. You'd be gone like a thief in the night. The noise grew louder as the rain intensified, punctuated by the occasional rumble. You calmed your nerves, but you couldn't shake the feeling something was not right. The hairs on your neck were standing straight up. Your hunch was proven correct when you felt warm breath wash over your head.

Your arms were pinned to your sides and you levitated up into the air. You couldn't see anyone, but you felt it. The warm fur of the bear against your body. Soft giggling emanated out of thin air. You looked around but the room was empty. A low hum echoed through the room and out of nothing the bear woman appeared. First her head, then the rest of her. She materialized around you, revealing her powerful grasp on you. She squeezed you in her bearhug to show you there was no tricks involved in that part. Her smile was wide and she spoke mockingly. "Ha, you should've seen your face! Oh no, where did the big scary bear come from and why am I floating?" She snorted with laughter, a light spray of bear spit and snot showering your face. "What's the matter? Lost your tongue? Nothing clever to say?" Her squeezing grip didn't allow for much in the way of breathing, let alone talking. "Thought so." she huffed, adding even more pressure to her already powerful crushing hold.

Finally her monstrous bear hug subsided. Does she eat you straight away or will she play around with after turning invisible again?
15111222221.title: a cloaking device

choices: You escape the room with the bear in hot pursuit.
151112222211.content:
One more little squeeze was the bear's parting gift as she threw you to the ground. She walked around the large office space and closed the doors, her cloaking device slowly fading her into the room. A disembodied voice spoke to you. "Go on, try to escape the big bad bear." Laughter followed, its source barely trackable. The heavy rain drowned out the sound of her footsteps, leaving you nothing but idle guessing to her location. You hold your head groggily and looked around. Your ribs still ached from her crushing hug, giving you plenty of motivation to avoid another close encounter with the invisible bear woman. Suddenly a stack of binders fell off a table. She must've bumped into them. You quickly determine which door was furthest from that point and closest to you and make a mad dash for it. You had one corner left to run when you hit an invisible furry wall. The impact was nothing compared to the strong arms wrapping you into another hug. Raucous laughter filled the air as the bear taunted you.

"Awwww, you wanted another hug so badly?" She hoisted you off your feet and squeezed you even tighter. It felt like she was trying to snap you in half. Again you were thrown to the ground as she walked away, hiding for her next move. You gasped for the air she violently pushed out of your lungs and slowly you tried to get up again. Apparently she was not happy with your sluggishness. A heavy foot planted itself on your back, pressing you back down and pinning you against the ground. An annoyed voice spoke overhead.

"If you're not going to take this seriously, I'll just have to eat you." The ursine foot twisted and ground your body into the floor, lending more weight to her argument. When she stepped away again you shot up. Judging by the shape of her foot on your back you could safely determine she was probably behind you. Directly ahead was a door, practically beckoning you to run to it and escape this madwoman. A few quick bounds was all it took your panicked legs. But when you were almost able to reach the handle, two big paws grabbed your sides and flung you away. You landed on a desk, slid through several computers and trays of paperwork and slammed down into the narrow pathway between two rows of desks. There was only one way out of this dead end, and you were certain that invisible bear woman was standing in it. That is, unless you used your brain for a second. You ducked under the desks, crawling beneath them to the next set with a new bid at freedom. You heard a vague murmuring, the bear approving of your spirited escape attempts. You kept crawling, hoping she hadn't noticed your plan yet. At the end of this, only a few more desks away, was a door.

Either she noticed or the bear woman simply wanted to raise the stakes, because one of the desks you were under just seconds ago lifted up. With great power it was thrown aside. She was right behind you and she wasn't going to bother crawling under desks to reach you. The next desk in her way suffered a similar fate. The third desk didn't get picked up. Instead a powerful smash from her clawed hand reduced it to splinters. The violence spurred you on to crawl even faster. The cacophony of desks shattering just behind you was terrifying. Just a little bit more and you could try your hand at freedom. With a glimmer of hope in your eyes you push yourself onwards towards the door.
151112222211.title: more fun with the cloaking device.

1511122222112.content:
You lunge for the door as the desk just behind you gets destroyed. Mercifully it wasn't locked and you push yourself through. You had a shot at escape once again, but the playful invisible bear woman was right behind you. You run down the alleyway and spot a chance at salvation. Up ahead was a fire extinguisher. You grab it and duck around a corner. "Come on..." You whisper loudly to yourself as you pull away all the safety measures and prepare your stand. Why were there so many pins and latches on emergency equipment? You were being chased by an invisible bear woman, you didn't have time for this! Finally the extinguisher is freed from all the safety pins. You fire a small burst onto the ground and wait. When a large ursine footprint appears you aim at where you think her head would be and unload.

A large cloud of dry ice enshrouds your pursuer. The intense cold air causing her to hack and cough loudly. This should buy you a minute at most. Enough to have a solid chance at escape. You fling the extinguisher away and make a mad dash for your life. You heart was beating faster that ever before. Fear spurred you on to new speeds in the knowledge that if this bear got her hands on you again there would be no more playing around. She was going to eat you and the only thing that might stop her would now be a fiery desire to hurt you first. You did not want to think about all the way in which she was going to do that.

Your time was limited and a deafening furious roar put a chill in your bones. She was coming and you had two options. Either you leave the building and make a run for it or you hide yourself somewhere in this office block. Neither were desirable strategies to you. You were fairly certain she could outrun with one leg strapped to her back. But she would probably also be able to sniff you out if you were still in her vicinity. Whichever you pick, you need to make up your mind fast.
1511122222112.title: You escape the room with the bear in hot pursuit.

choices: She puts your feet in her maw
She feels you haven't been hurt enough yet
15111222221121.content:
You scurry into a nearby bathroom and hide in one of the toilets. Your heart is racing whilst you quietly pray to whoever might listen. Heavy steps thunder down the hallway, low feral growling making you gulp. She had not forgotten your little stunt with the fire extinguisher, and she definitely had not forgiven. All you could hope for was that her nose wouldn't be able to lead her to you. You think back to biology classes. Did bears have a good sense of smell or was it a good sense of hearing? You cannot remember, but just to be sure you hold your breath whenever those heavy footfalls are anywhere near you. The toilets hadn't been tended to since the invasion a few weeks ago. It smelled pretty foul, hopefully enough so to hide your fear.

You don't know how much time has passed. You barely dare to move a muscle. The heavy gait of the bear woman patrolling the hallways sounds slower and calmer every time. Finally it stops midway. She's not moving. What could have stopped her? Was she finally getting bored of chasing you? Or did she finally determine your hiding place?

With an explosion of noise the bear woman kicks in the door to the toilets. It flies off its hinges and falls apart, showering the stalls with splinters. You put your hands in front of your mouth and hold your breath, shaking in every limb of your body. Loud sniffing filled the air. Oh no, she'd tracked you down. The stalls shook as she tore open the one furthest from the door. A disappointed growl followed her discovery of an empty stall. She was not going to leave it at that. You panicked, desperate to escape. When the second stall door came down you opened yours and made a frantic dash for the doorway.

It was to no avail as you feel her large shoulder ram into your back. You stumble forwards, smacking into the office wall opposing the toilets. You're not given any time to think as the bear shoulder-charges you again, plowing herself straight through the wall with you to take the blow. The cloaking device was off, allowing you to see the rage in her eyes. You were sprawled out on the floor, the bear woman looming over you. A heavy foot found its way to your chest and you howl in pain. She wasn't holding back anymore. With a satisfied grunt she brought her foot down on you over and over again. Every part of your chest got some of its heavy attention. Finally she stomped down on your crotch, making you scream out even louder. With a chuckle the bear woman kicked you over. Your dare not look behind you, but you know what is coming.

The bear woman turns around and kneels, hovering her huge fuzzy ass just above you. With a playful hop she kicks her legs out from under her and crushes you under her mighty rear. Your torso is flattened a little under the sheer amount of mass resting on it. Quickly she shuffles herself backwards, the jiggly cheeks sliding around your head. Quickly it was surrounded by the smelly bear butt and treated to a few small farts. Most of your body was now lying free, wracked with pain from her stomping and at the mercy of the bear sitting on your head. A loud, victorious fart rumbles around you, drowning you in her fetid stench. What does the bear woman do next?
15111222221121.title: Hide in the toilets

choices: Squash and pulverize you with her gigantic ass
She uses you as a q-tip to clean out her gunk filled nostrils
15112.content: You look up, your energy almost completely spent from that burst of nasty and gross smells. You don’t even wanna know what made those kind of smells in the first place. You soon see a pair of hoof-like feet, gazelle-like, standing right in front of you. You move your gaze slowly up the owner’s body to see that it truly is a shapely and tall gazelle woman. You notice her thick thighs and door-blocking hips, each butt cheeks and breast on her body is easily as big as you’re entire body. You quiver underneath the gaze of this tall and curvy gazelle as she grins at you mischievously, “Well, well, well… what do we have here?” What does she do to you?
15112.title: They're gazelle feet

151121.content: Placing her hoof under your chin, she shoves you onto our back. You can't even try to struggle up before she turns around and kicks her feet out from under her. Her ass slams on top of you. She giggles as she leans back and forth, grinding each cheek into you.
151121.title: Squash and pulverize you with her gigantic ass

15113.content: Do they belong to one of those cat ladies? Or a puma?
15113.title: Something else

1512.content:
You decide to head to the Savannah area in hopes of finding the Skunk Queen there. It seemed logical, the Savannah area head large and powerful animals that would be well suited for hunting down humans, so you head forth. However, one part you didn't know was that the zoo staff, controlled by the Queen, had been experimenting on some of the animals their with strange results. The two main ones was turning feral animals into anthros, but still have feral minds, and giving the intellect of anthros to the feral animals.

When you come to the first part of the Savannah, you notice all the cages are busted wide open and empty. You realize all the animals are now free and can hunt you down with ease and think to head back. You're stopped by your ambition, you had to stop the Queen and free everybody! With a strong gulp, you sneak around to avoid detection from any potential animals around you. You hear a rustling noise ahead of you on the other side of a wall. What was it, an animal? A green cat minion? The Queen? you think to yourself as you gently slide against the wall and look around the corner to see....
1512.title: Go to the artificial savannah

choices: You sneak further into the zoo
You sneak away from the zoo
15121.content:
You saw a lioness walking on all fours. You were used to seeing lionesses walking on all fours, but something seemed off with this one. Looking closely, you realized what was wrong. This was one of those anthro lionesses, complete with breasts and firm hindquarters. But every anthro you've seen walked upright. Why was this one on all fours?

Your thoughts are interrupted when you saw her sniff the air. She turned towards where you were hiding and started to walk over, still on all fours. You decided now was not a good time to ask questions. You've gotta get away!
15121.title: A dumb anthro lioness?

choices: The ass of an animal with fur
An animal of a different kind...
151211.content:
You managed to slip by the doofus looking lioness and continue further into the zoo. As you get further in, you noticed that a lot more of the exhibits being empty because the animals have broken loose when the skunk lady arrived. You also that some of the animal's footprints were bigger than normal and it startled you a bit. The bigger footprints meant that the animals have somehow gotten bigger than usual, possibly by the aliens' hands.

Before you could come up with a theory, you had somehow bumped into the huge rear end of an animal that reeked...

Which kind of animal was it?
151211.title: You sneak further into the zoo

1512111.content: You back up a bit and look up to see what you had bumped into. It's the hairy rear end of an animal . The size of the figure seemed much bigger than any of the animals here that you remembered. Perhaps she the Queen used some formulas on them to increase their size? You examine further to see it is a ________.
1512111.title: Intelligent Feral

choices: The gazelle clenches to keep you from escaping as it continues to fart
15121111.content: Upon getting a closer look of the animal, you notice that it was a huge gazelle. You erf as a faint smell hits you as look over the animal more from behind. Unbeknownst to you, this animal has also a heightened intelligence level, meaning it is a lot smarter than the other gazelles. Before you could do much else, the huge animal bends her back legs and sits her huge butt down onto you, pinning you between the rump cheeks. You groan as the smell is a little stronger than before and the cheeks seem to keep you in place. Before long, you hear a faint grumble before a huge fart rips over you, causing you to gag! You have to try to slip away before this animal does anything else disgusting to you!
15121111.title: Gazelle

choices: You wake up the next morning
She rolls over on you in the night!
15121112.content:
Suddenly, you bump into a strange, soft wall. Or at least, you think it’s a wall. That is until you turn around, and realize you had actually stumbled right into the massive rear of a 10-foot tall zebra! This thing looked twice as big as a regular zebra, and, judging from the rear you just bumped into, very obviously female. The equine looked to be about the size of an elephant! How is this even possible? Just what did those aliens do to these poor aliens? Luckily, it seemed to be sleeping, so you try your best to sneak away...

“Huh…?” You hear a low, feminine voice ask all of a sudden. You look around for its source… only to realize that it’s coming from the zebra! “Who’s there?” Startled awake, the zebra lifts her head and scans her surroundings, only to suddenly jump to her hooves when she lays eyes on you. “A HUMAN!” She yells in a booming voice, looking over you. You lift your hands in front of your face, prepared for the massive zebra to squash you into the dirt, but… she doesn’t move a muscle. She just looks really excited. “Oh my god! I’ve been waiting so long for a human to come back!”

You look around the area again, only to confirm that, yes, this zebra really is talking. “W-what do you mean?” you ask the giant equine looming over you, just hoping you don’t get eaten.

“I LOVE entertaining the humans, but… one day, I got really big all of a sudden, and the humans stopped coming to the zoo…” She reminisced, sadly. “Is it because I’m really big now? That’s the reason, isn’t it?” She started to sound very sad, now, and slightly desperate. “I-it’s not my fault! I can still be entertaining! Honest!”

You don’t really know how to react to a 10-foot tall zebra having an emotional breakdown right in front of you. “I-I don’t really know why people stopped coming…” You lied, thinking that if you gave an honest answer, she’d probably just step on you.

“S-so, you don’t mind that I’m so big now?” she said, perking up a little bit.

Of course you mind. This was terrifying! “... no,” you lie again.

She instantly lights up, getting a determined look on her face. “Then I’ll make sure to make you the most entertained visitor you can possibly be!” She spent the next 5 minutes doing a wide variety of tricks while you watch, which were impressive to varying degrees, mostly because she was so large. But during the whole show, you were constantly looking for an opportunity to escape, and after a while, you started making motions for the exit. “Wait! No! Y-you don’t have to leave! Watch this!” Desperate to entertain you, she tried standing on her hind legs… but she didn’t expect the increased weight her size bestowed upon her. She stumbled backwards, and you realized the clumsy zebra’s huge rear was heading straight towards you!

Suddenly, 2000 pounds of zebra dropped right on top of you, pressing you against the ground. Luckily, her rump was so soft, it cushioned the blow, preventing you from being injured. Still, being pressed against the ground by the huge zebra’s sweaty, smelly rump was the opposite of pleasant. “Ow! Sorry, I fell…” she said, before looking around and realizing you were nowhere to be seen. “Human? Where did you go?” You were stuck under her for a while, until you finally found the strength to wriggle around, making the huge zebra realized she had accidentally sat on you!

“Oh no! Human, I am… SO sorry!” she immediately stood up, looking horrified as she saw you groaning on the ground where she was just sitting. Even once she rose off of you, you still smelled like zebra butt. “I’m just so big now, and I-I don’t know how to do any tricks around anymore, and…” She desperately tries to explain herself, and you realized she was starting to cry profusely. “It was an accident! P-please don’t leave! I know I’m useless, but…” At this point, she was hardly able to say anything through her desperate tears. “I just… I don’t want… to be… aloooohohohone!” Just the mention of the word ‘alone’ made the zebra lay down and weep into her hooves. This would be the perfect time to escape, but… you couldn’t just leave her there while she’s crying, even if she is an 10-foot tall talking zebra.

You stand there as she sobs for a while, covering her eyes with her hooves. Eventually, she calms down a bit, and seemed to assume you had just left. “Who am I kidding? I can’t entertain anybody anymore…” she whimpered silently to herself. Not wanting to let her stew in misery any more, you poke her in her huge side. She turns around to you, stunned. “H-huh? You’re still here!?” She asks, eyes wide.

“I think you’re pretty entertaining,” you say, simply, looking up at the giant equine.

She stares at you, and for a moment, you thought she was crying again… until you realize those were tears of joy! “Thank you, little human!” She smiles, nuzzling you close with her big, furry cheek. You found yourself hugging her back, even though you were still a tad disturbed by the giant, talking zebra. After a while, she composes herself. “Well, anyway, uh… welcome to the zoo! What did you come for today?”

“I was… looking for a place to stay…” you said.

“Well, you can stay here with me!” she offered. “I’m super big, so I can keep you super safe!” You looked up at the sunset. It would be dark, soon… and you really don’t want to be wandering the safari alone at night. The talking zebra lady seemed alright, you suppose.

“For tonight, sure, I’ll stay with you,” you nod, and she practically jumps with excitement.

You impress the zebra by starting a campfire in the center of the savannah. “Wow! How’d you do that?” She gasps, starting in the flames, awestruck. You chuckled, seeing the massive zebra so amazed by a simple human.

“If you think that’s impressive, wait till you hear about the internet…” The huge zebra curled up comfortably around you by the fire, and you leaned up against her soft belly, relaxing as you told her all about the human world. She responded, in turn, by telling you about all the mundane details of her own life… boring in comparison, but the enthusiastic way she talked made it surprisingly entertaining. Soon, you feel asleep, snuggled up safely with the giant equine...
15121112.title: Zebra

151211122.content:
That night, you dreamed of the way the world used to be. You had a house, a girlfriend, all the luxuries of modern life… back then, everything seemed so simple. Sure, you’d occasionally watch the news and bite your nails, but when it came down to it, the sleepy little small town you lived in was about as comfortable and safe as it could get. But fantasies aren’t meant to last… and before you knew it, you were knocked back into the real world by thousands of pounds of weight sliding on top of you…

You groaned, your voice muffled completely by the weight you found yourself crushed by. Your drowsy mind struggles to remember the events of the past night, but eventually you realized that the clumsy zebra had rolled over on top of you! In her deep slumber, she had apparently rolled over from her side, pinning you down to the ground beneath her huge, soft belly. Now, you were emerged in the natural scent of the unwashed zebra, hardly able to move an inch beneath the ton of belly flesh that covered your body.

“Damn this zebra…” you grumbled. You knew she meant well, but she was clumsy as can be. You spent a few minutes wriggling around beneath her as much as you can, trying to rouse the sleeping equine, to no end. However, after wriggling around for half an hour, you did manage to move a few inches. Noticing this, you gritted your teeth and settled in for the long haul, squirming beneath the equine as much as you could in a bid to wriggle your way to freedom. Considering you’ve barely gotten any sleep tonight, much less the past week, this struggle pushed you to your absolute limits.

But eventually, you finally saw light… only to realize you’d crawled your way to right beneath the equine’s hindquarters. By this point, every muscle in your body was exhausted beyond belief, and you didn’t have the energy to fully pull yourself out from beneath the zebra’s body. Thus, you lazily watched the sunset from beneath the equine’s muff, trying to ignore the smell and the swinging of the equine’s tail. Eventually, you felt the zebra start to shift and groan, slowly waking up.

“Aahh…” she yawns loudly. Your night might of miserable, but she obviously got a good night’s sleep, apparently. “Good morning, human…” She says, only to look around and see no trace of the tiny human she was sleeping beside the night before. “Human?” She calls out, sounding worried. Right as you were about to answer her, she sat up on her haunches, suddenly crushing your frail body beneath her massive rear once again! You screamed in disgust and frustration as your body was pressed between the equine’s sweaty cheeks, your voice muffled completely by your smelly surroundings.

“Oh no…” She gasped, standing up. Instead of being left on the ground like you were expected, you were instead hoisted in the air by the zebra’s rump, still partially lodged between her soft cheeks. “Did the human leave!?” She sounded panicked -- too panicked to notice the tiny obstruction wriggling around in her rear. Her cheeks ground back and forth as she walked, only maintaining her unintentional hold on you, if not driving you even deeper. Your protests went completely unheard, and eventually all you can do is groan as you’re forced to endure the noxious smell of her ass.

The zebra searches around desperately for you, giving you an impromptu ride through the savannah. Occasionally, you will be driven to tears by the noxious smell of the zebra’s gas, the tiniest far hitting you like a tidal wave from your perch just inches from her huge tailhole. You had never particularly enjoyed the smell of wild animals, but this was the most disgusting thing you’ve experienced in your life. To make matters worse, you were forced to hear the zebra start crying again. “H-he just left me…” the zebra sobbed, as if in disbelief. “He really did hate me…”

Even while trapped in her rear end, you couldn’t help but feel a little sorry for the emotionally sensitive zebra. Unfortunately, you have bigger problems to worry about. As she walked, your frail body slipped closer and closer to her waiting tailhole. You weren’t quite sure what would happen if you got too close, but you didn’t want to imagine. You start wriggling with all your might; even though this accelerates your descent into her rear, it’s also your only chance of making the zebra realize you’re here...
151211122.title: Rude Awakening

1512111222.content:
You found yourself face-to-face with the zebra’s fat pucker. You were too terrified to even struggle, afraid that any movement might slide you even closer. You can only hold your current position, praying that the equine would just notice you already. Meanwhile, the zebra seemed saddened by the loss of the only persons she’s spoken to in weeks. “Well, f-fine! I d-didn’t need him anyway…” She whispered to herself sadly, giving up the search. Your heart leaped as you noticed the zebra leaning backwards. She was sitting down! The second her rear collided with the dirt ground, you felt your upper body be plunged through a tight sphincter, like a huge donut hole was wrapped around your waist. “Ow!” The zebra yelped in surprise.

“D-did I just sit on something?” She said, standing up on shaky legs, inspecting the area where she just sat, but finding nothing. Meanwhile, your nostrils were being assaulted by the worst smell you could ever imagine, as the equine’s bowels squeeze painfully tightly around you from all sides. You immediately struggle with all your might, only serving to agitate her rectum further. A muscle spasm rocked your prison, slowly pulling your lower body up inside the zebra’s tailhole as well. Soon, you felt the tight sphincter close around your feet, sealing you in darkness. “Ugh…” She groaned, nauseated by the feeling of something sliding into her.

She was confused for a few moments when she noticed something was moving around inside her, until she recognized the humans. “Human? Is that you?” She gasped, looking back at her own rear end. “Oh no! Did I…? Are you alright in there!?” You rubbed on the walls of your prison, letting the zebra know exactly where you were trapped. You tried to remain as calm as you could; you had a bit of oxygen available within her, but it was stale, and you didn’t know how long it would last.

“Oh no, oh no, oh no...” She said, hopping on her hooves, panicking. She had messed up a lot in the past, but this time she had done something REALLY bad -- and in her sleep, no less! She had no idea if it was even possible to get you out in time. “What do I do? What do I do?” She repeated to herself, starting to cry. “... I really wish I had hands…” Meanwhile, you just hunkered down, holding your hands desperately over your nose, trying futilely to block out the smell inside of her. The air inside of her fetid bowels was so vile, it stung painfully at your nostrils and made you light-headed.

The equine reluctantly tries to push you out, but the tight sphincter only seems to want to open one way, and thus all she succeeds in doing is pressing the walls of her bowels even tighter around you. Groaning in pain and disgust, you pound on the wall with your hand with the little strength you have left. “Sorry! Sorry!” She apologized, searching for another option. She shambles awkwardly around the artificial savannah, the obstruction within her rear almost making her fall over. The heat inside of her was sweltering, giving you even less energy to try to escape. Whether you ever made it out of here was all up to her now…

Meanwhile, the zebra just couldn’t stop shaking. How could she have been so stupid? Of course she would’ve rolled over on the human in her sleep! Before the cataclysm, she was the most popular animal in the zoo… but with her new size, she couldn’t help but hurt everybody she interacted with. She was useless… a burden! She swore that once this was all over, she would go live as far away as society as possible, so that she would never both anybody else. But that had to wait until later… for now, she still had to rescue the human…

To the zebra’s horror, when she returns to the spot she had once been sleeping, she found another animal sniffing at the torn remains of the human’s shirt… a lioness! The lioness stood at roughly 6 feet from paws to withers; much smaller than the zebra, but large enough to have been a constant pain in the equine’s side. The lioness looked up at her as she approached, smiling that same smug smirk she always does. “So… apparently, a human has stumbled upon our humble little savannah…” The lioness asked. “You wouldn’t happen to know about that, would you?” The zebra shuddered. She’d seen many creatures fall victim to the lioness’ appetite since the cataclysm, but the feline had always expressed a desire to swallow a human in particular. And the only human that had ever visited the zoo was currently between the equine’s cheeks…

The zebra was stuck. She was desperate to fix the mistake she had made, but she also didn’t want to make another one. At the moment, the only way she could possibly free the human was to enlist the lioness’ help… but the lioness would probably try to take the human for herself afterwards! Should the zebra take that chance to get the human out as fast as possible, or should she just… leave him in there for the time being?
1512111222.title: Bowel Movement

choices: Help her find somewhere new to live
15121112221.content:
The zebra sighed. She didn’t have the dexterity to deal with this herself; while she didn’t want to enlist the lioness’ help, it was probably the right thing to do. “Well… there was a human here,” she confessed, hesitantly. “B-but I sort of… sat on him…” The zebra gestured towards her own rump, and the feline sat staring at her, as if dumbstruck. The zebra cringed as the lioness suddenly let out a piercing laugh.

“You did WHAT?” she managed to choke out, while rolling on the floor, laughing gleefully at the humiliated equine.

“C’mon, this is serious!” The zebra begged, her cheeks going red with embarrassment. She shifted her hips, uncomfortable with the feeling of the human inside. “I don’t know how much air he has in there…” The lioness eventually composes herself, her open laughter downgrading to smug amusement.

“Ooohhh. So he’s in deep, huh?” She asked, the same old smug smirk on her face -- god, it was annoying! “Let me guess… you want me to get the poor sucker out?”

“Well… yes…” The zebra hesitantly agreed, humiliated at having to enlist the feline’s help. “But you have to promise not to try and eat him! At least, not today!”

“Psh… like I’d WANT to eat him knowing where he’s been…” The lioness giggles. “But you owe me for this!”

The zebra was a little surprised by how fast the lioness agreed to this little ‘favor’. She thought it would take a lot more convincing to get the egotistical lioness to crawl up her rear end. The equine hesitantly turned around and laid her belly down on the dirt ground of the savannah, hesitantly raising her tail for the amused feline. “Okay, so, just… be gentle…” She asked, shyly.

“Ooh la la. Quite a view back here,” the lioness teased, making the zebra even more red with embarrassment. She didn’t want to get so… intimate with the lioness, but it needs to be done. She just wanted to get this over with as soon as possible. The feline inspects the equine’s rear, only to find no trace of the human. “Hm… he really is in deep,” She grimaced, already starting to regret agreeing to this… but a promise is a promise. The zebra yelped as she felt the lioness’ head plunge into her unwashed rear, searching for the human within her bowels, seemingly deterred by the abhorrent smell. Unfortunately, the human doesn’t seem to be anywhere to be found. “REALLY deep,” she realized. For a moment, the lioness suspected that this entire thing might be a trick… but it seems unlikely the zebra would come up with something so conniving. If the equine did try to trap her in her bowels, she could just claw her way out, anyway.

With that in mind, the lioness pushed her forepaws through the tight sphincter. She wriggled around, stretching the hole as wide as possible, trying to get in and out before she ran out of air. “Oh! Ah! Y-you’re moving too fast!” The zebra cried out, gasping and panting as she was hit by waves of pain and pleasure in equal measures. It took all the concentration she had not to just suck the feline in completely. The lioness had to press deeper and deeper, until she was halfway inside, before she was finally able to grab you by your foot. At this point, you only had the barest semblance of consciousness, and could only allow yourself to be limply dragged along as the lioness pulled the both of you out of the tight passage with her hind legs.

Suddenly, with one last pull from the lioness, you were finally freed from the tight, oppressive confines. You landed on the cool ground, gasping in as much fresh air as you possibly can. You look over at the zebra to see her lying on her side, with barely enough energy to move, overwhelmed by the sensations she had experienced. You turn again to see your savior; a massive lioness, her beaming yellow eyes looking down at you, a smirk on her face. “Welcome back, human,” she cackled, seeing what a bad state you were in. “Jeez. How long have you been in there?” The smell of the equine’s gas still clung to the both of you, though not nearly as intensely as before. “I think we should get washed off. What do you say?” With waiting for you to reply, the lioness lifts you up onto her back with her tail. You’re too tired to resist as the lioness walks off with you, and the zebra doesn’t even notice.

About a half hour later, you had recuperated fully, bathing in a natural spring on the edge of the savannah. You make small with the lioness as you help her wash the smell off with berries and herbs, the two of you discussing the events of the cataclysm and the solitary lives you’ve been living since then. The lioness seems to be quite devious, with a penchant for teasing you -- on several occasions, she refers to you as ‘tasty’, which makes you feel very uncomfortable. Eventually, however, the zebra trotted up again, looking panicked. “Oh, thank goodness you’re okay, human!” She sighed in relief, perhaps worried that the lioness might have devoured you.

“Of course he’s okay. Do you think I would ever harm such a defenseless little human?” She chuckled. “C’mon, you look like you’ve had a hard day. Come swim with us.”

The zebra hesitated, as if there was something on her mind. “Well… okay,” she nodded, before walking into the cool, rejuvenating waters of the mountain spring, and sitting down on the other side from you. “But… I just wanted to say that I’m sorry. And I think I’ll be leaving the zoo.”

Even the smug lioness seemed disarmed by this. “Why?” She asked. “You love it here!”

“I’m too big for it, now. Too clumsy,” the zebra said, obviously feeling guilty to the point of holding back tears. “What if I accidentally step on somebody? It’s not fair to the visitors of the zoo to have to be afraid of me.”

The two of you stare at her for a while, taken aback. “Where are you going to go?” You finally ask.

She seemed even more saddened by the thought, though she tried desperately to keep herself composed. “I-I don’t know,” she said, not having really thought it through. “I… guess I’ll just find some new place to live… alone…” You were a little tired of the zebra’s clumsiness, but seeing her tear up like this broke your heart. She was obviously passionate about the zoo. You didn’t want to ruin her whole life like this. You had to do something...
15121112221.title: Fresh Air!

1512112.content: The bump causes you to fall on your butt. "Ah! What the hell!" you yell. Unfortunately, your yell had alerted the large figure in front of you to your presence. In the top of your vision, you vaguely see the massive figure turning its head around to your direction. You're shocked to see it's a...
1512112.title: An animal of a different kind...

15121121.content:
Upon seeing the animal, you let out a sigh of relief. It was just a big hippo. You thanked the heavens you got lucky. The hippo seemed to grin, and you looked on in confusion.

"Looks like someone brought me my dinner," the hippo said, boasting a deep, feminine voice. She opened her mouth wide, and tried to snap her jaws over you, but you were able to dodge the snap. You ran, deciding not to go down the path towards the lioness from before. "Hey! I'm starving, brat!" You looked over your shoulder as you ran, and saw the aquatic animal chasing after you. You screamed out and kept running. You ran...
15121121.title: Feral Hippo

choices: They belonged to a polar bear
151211211.content: You turned a corner, and wound up right in the middle of the arctic section of the zoo. You leapt over a railing and onto a patch of ice in the middle of a freezing lake. The hippo kept chasing you, but stopped near the water. She tapped a foot in the water, and shivered. She turned and scampered off, you sighing in response. However, your relief wouldn't last long. You heard stomping behind you.
151211211.title: ...to the arctic area

choices: She smothers you beneath her flabby body
She tries to convince you to warm up in her stomach
1512112112.content:
The heavy thuds came from just behind an outcrop of ice. Soon a seal head emerged, looking to find the source of all of this commotion. When it locked eyes with you it seemed angry, but the incensed scowl soon made place for a sultry smile. Given the size of the head and how low to the ground it was hovering you could only assume this seal to be feral like the hippo you've just evaded. You hope this new animal is a little more reasonable. With a few more heavy thuds caused by the seal skipping forward it came into view. A large and fatty body, easily outclassing the hippo's in size. There was no sign of alien tampering with this animal aside from the wildly unnatural size.

"Well, hello there... who are you?" It asked. You were surprised for a moment it could speak at all. Then again, you just managed to dodge a talking, maneating hippo. Perhaps one day all these talking animals will become normal for you. For now you just counted your lucky stars this large seal didn't also want you in her belly.

"I'm lost and looking for a way out of the zoo. Preferably one without any animals trying to eat me." You replied.

"Leaving already? But we only just met." The seal pouted. You weren't sure where this was going, but her smile was sending a shiver down your spine. You mull over your options. You were safe from your previous pursuer, but you were stuck on a small icy hillock in a freezing cold lake. And if you wanted to go to a piece of shore that didn't lead back to the hippo it was quite the swim. The seal didn't want you to leave so soon, and a devious plan was hatched. With surprising grace she slid her pudgy body into the water. You quickly lost sight of her in the murky depths and focused your attention on finding a piece of ice sturdy enough to float to a shore with. With great power the seal breaches out of the water right next to you, landing back in the lake with a huge splash. The freezing wave of water soaked you from head to toe. You began shivering almost immediately. With a victorious smile the seal surged out of the water, sliding herself back onto land and standing before you.

"What an unfortunate turn of events. You can't leave here with your clothes all soaking wet and cold. You'll freeze to death here in the Arctic Zone. A good thing you have a friend like me who can help you out." You resist sarcastically rolling your eyes and quietly nod. "There's two things I think we can do to get you warmed up again."
1512112112.title: They belonged to a seal

choices: ...the seal expects a favor in return.
15121121121.content:
"Firstly I could swallow you and let you rest up in my warm stomach. But since I saw you run from that mean ol hippo I'm going to guess you're not the stomach type." The seal explains whilst you nod sheepishly. "So I won't waste any time telling you how safe it really is and how I'd let you back out when you're all warm and happy again." There's a frustrated tone in her voice, but she begins to smile a little before her next sentence. "Thankfully, seals like me have adapted to these freezing temperatures thanks to a thick coat of blubber." She slaps her belly with a flipper, causing it to jiggle. You're not wholly certain here she is going with this, but the icy cold waterlogged clothes you wear make it hard to object to any offer of warmth. "Now obviously I can't just magically give you your own layer of blubber, so you'll have to borrow mine." She said excitedly. She hops close to you and leans up high, towering over you. Absent-mindedly she added one last sentence:

"I'm sure the weight will be fine..."

Your eyes widen as it dawns on you how she intends to let you 'borrow' her fatty coat. She wants to flatten you under her huge body! You scramble to get away, but the slippery surface of the frozen little island you're on causes you to fall almost immediately. Heavy thuds slowly approach as you're lying on your back in the snow. An immense bulk is then placed on your feet. this was it, you weren't going anywhere. Another hop covered your legs up to the knee. The seal looked down and tilted her head in confusion. Was this human trying to flee from her or did he just lie down to help with her plan? One last skip forward left the large seal covering your legs entirely. The weight was intense, her towering fatty body rolling over you like a blubbery wave.

She then began to lie down herself. No longer hoisting a large section of her body up but instead just putting herself right on top of the shivering little man. You panicked as her blubbery form quickly engulfed your own. Not a sound could escape the thick layer of fat smothering you and the weight utterly immobilized you. "Don't be afraid, think of it as a big warm blanket." She said reassuringly. She had covered you so completely that to the outside viewer there was no trace at all of you. The only solace in this waking oppressive nightmare was the fact that she hadn't lied about the warmth. Mired in curiously smelling skin and heavy mass you had to admit her body was quite comfortably warm. She regularly lifted her head a tiny bit, just enough for you to suck in a fresh lungful of air. All goes well until...
15121121121.title: She smothers you beneath her flabby body

choices: She takes you to her cave.
She goes looking for food with you.
151211211212.content:
"Feeling better yet?" The seal asked.

"mmhmhmmffm" could be heard coming from underneath her. Her huge, fatty body had done it's job and provided you with the warmth you needed. The seal rolled onto her side, keeping one of your arms pinned. Still, your body was finally relieved from that monstrous bulk flattening it.

"Much better." She cooed. "My name is Sandra."

"Nice to meet you Sandra." You spoke with some uncertainty. Politeness seemed the best course of action for now, especially with her still having you pinned. It wouldn't take much for her to just roll back on top of you and squash you again. And if she was angry you might not get the benefit of regular breathing breaks.

"Now let's talk about how you're going to repay me for warming you up."

"What?! You're the reason I was soaked to begin with!"

"Or I could throw you into the freezing lake." You paused, faced with the prospect of possibly freezing to death.

With a resigned groan you sigh out: "What do you want?"

Sandra smiled, happy she could persuade you. "Well, I'm kinda lonely, will you keep me company for a day?" You really wanted to get on with your mission to stop the Queen. But if you refused her offer, Sandra might throw you into the icy waters. All things considered just keeping her company for a day didn't seem too difficult. You nod your head at the seal, who immediately jiggles with joy. She shuffles her large body aside some more to free your trapped arm. You stretch your squashed self a little before getting back on your feet. The seal's smile then turns blank as she leans up to meet you eye to eye. "Just one thing. If I find out you tricked me to escape, I will personally dunk you in the lake and wait until the cold makes you an easy prey." You gulp, but keep smiling. She puts her beaming smile on again and leads you on.
151211211212.title: The seal expects a favor in return.

choices: She's full and takes you to her cave.
1512112112122.content:
As the two of you wander the arctic area you get curious about where you're going. The seal was looking around a lot and seemed unsure of the route herself. When you reach a dead end you finally man up and ask her. "Where are we going?"

"We're looking for food, I haven't eaten for at least a day, and my beautiful body requires a lot of attention." You gulp a little, as you suddenly realize you were in a dead end with her standing inbetween you and the only way out. You clear your throat and look at Sandra. She looks at you with confusion, then begins to laugh as the realization hit her.

"Hahaha, I'm sorry little man. I didn't mean to make that look like I was about to eat you. Truth is, I don't really know my way around here. The invasion was only days ago and suddenly growing ten times taller took some time to get used to." She pauses for a moment, thinking about something. "Come to think of it, I might be able to get to some of the back rooms with you. I won't fit through those narrow doors, but you can look for me." You were reassured by this. Knowing you held a purpose for her other then walking snack was heartening. "And if you don't find anything all day, then I guess you can be my insurance." So much for that. You knew exactly what she was talking about. If you didn't find any food, Sandra was going to eat you.

You find one of the maintenance areas and walk in looking for some fish. The room definitely smelled like it had some fish in it about to go bad. You hope the seal wouldn't be a picky eater. Following your nose, you stumble across two large crates of fish. "I think I got something here." You tell her. "Good, bring it to me, I'm starving. It took some effort, but you managed to push the crates towards the door. The seal's large head was just about the only thing that fit through and she eagerly began to eat. She worked through the fish with remarkable speed, barely bothering to chew them. When she was finished Sandra let out a satisfied belch. You grab your nose at the hot, fishy stench. She giggles a little and shuffles back. "Had enough?" You ask with your best fake smile.
1512112112122.title: She goes looking for food with you.

choices: Get smothered for warmth by a huge seal.
15121121121221.content:
Sandra offers a smaller but no less stinky second burp and giggles contently. "I think that'll do fine for today. Let's go someplace a bit more cozy. I'll show you where I live." The thought of making a run for it was enticing. But you would risk so much by just trying. With a big enough surprise headstart you might be able to outrun the fat seal. Fear sent a cold chill down your spine. There would be no way to convince the seal if the escape failed not to chow down. She'd devour you whole in a heartbeat if she didn't squish you first under her big body. Sandra wobbled in front of you, following the path through the exhibit. The wintry cages were all eerily quiet. Outside of the seal there didn't seem to be another living thing in here. Either they escaped or your big seal 'friend' has gobbled them all up. Hopefully not the latter. A seal with a taste for squirming, living prey in her belly was bad news for you. So far she seemed eager enough not to stuff you down her throat. Maybe she really does just want some company.

The seal enclosure is surrounded by a lake of freezing water. Without pause Sandra slides her large bulk into the ice cold waves. She floats herself to the surface and yells out to you: "Get on!" You hesitate, not trusting the seal to take you across. She'd already pulled tricks with the water, she wouldn't be above doing it again to keep you trapped. "You promised me you'd come to my place. We're crossing that lake, right now. You can come along on my back or in my belly, your choice." Well, so much for milling about on that idea. With shaky steps you shuffle to the water's edge. Sandra moves as close as possible and you jump on. You could feel your heart pounding in your chest. Getting a ride from a huge seal was not something you'd expect to do today. Simultaneously you were horrified that she might dive down and leave you stranded in the cold water. You'd be helpless to stop her from waiting until the cold made you into an easy meal. That is if she'd even bother waiting. The water was her home element. On land you could consider running, but in here she'd be so much faster than you.

You arrive on the seal island safely and dry. Sandra effortlessly slides her several tonnes of bulk out of the lake. The rocky island had a few tunnels to a nice, sheltered burrow. It could house dozens of seals or roughly one giant seal as Sandra demonstrated. She wobbled her way in through a large hole in the side of the rocky formation. The stench of rotten fish hung over the whole island. The seal's voice echoes from inside, asking you to enter. Careful not to hit your head you skulk inside. The first thing of note was the warmth. Without the biting wind the cold seemed a lot more bearable. That alone made the otherwise barren cave feel strangely homely. Secondly, you take note of the seal. She was laying on her side and winking at you. What exactly did she have in mind with you keeping her company?

"Take it easy, human. It's just going to be you and me in here. Now let's get this party started. Do you want to cuddle with big 'ol me? Or are you cold? Just lie down in front of me and big Sandra will warm you up."
15121121121221.title: She's full and takes you to her cave.

151211211212212.content:
There was no way of hiding it. You were shivering still from the cold outside. You'd been flattened by Sandra before and the one thing that surprised you was just how manageable her huge blubbery mass was. You'd expected boneshattering agony but all things considered it was quite pleasant. Pleasant and most definitely very warm. You set your doubts aside and wordlessly lie down next to the seal. Her knowing smile widens.

"Aw, the poor human is cold. Don't you fret one more second, big Sandra is here to help. Just shuffle yourself upwards a little so your head is clear." You agree, moving yourself in position for the seal to roll onto you without also smothering your face. With a tiny hop she begins to topple and soon her rolling fat body flops on top of you. The smothering mass immobilizes you immediately, pinning you up to your neck beneath several tons of warm seal blubber. Her head rolls into position right next to yours, those big dark eyes staring lovingly at you. You grit your teeth for a moment as you adjust to her weight.

Sandra nuzzles you a little, making you smile. The fishy stench in the cave aside, this was pretty great. Sandra seemed to agree, carrying the same warm smile as you. Though her reasons for smiling were perhaps not quite so friendly.

"This feels nice, doesn't it? You, pinned helplessly beneath me... I could do whatever I want to you now..." Her playful tone did nothing to ease your concern and you gulp loudly. What did you just agree to?

"Why, I could just..." Oh no, was she going to eat you? Were you really tricked so easily by this huge seal? You feel yourself beginning to panic as she brings her head closer to yours, hot breath washing over you. You close your eyes and accept your fate. But all you feel is her wet nose pressing against your forehead. You feared the touch of her powerful teeth around your skull and a monstrous chomp to end it all. You open your eyes to see her giddy smile hovering over you.

"Haha, got you good, didn't I? I already ate today, so you're off the menu, little man. Besides, I wasn't lying when I said I wanted some company. And you actually manned up and came with me. I'm a seal of my word, human. So you're free to leave tomorrow morning. Now there's one question that still needs answering. I think I can already take a good guess, but just in case... Do you want to stay under there for the night or do you prefer sleeping beside me?"
151211211212212.title: Get smothered for warmth by a huge seal.

choices: Sandra offers to take you off the island
Sandra is gone, you're stuck on the island
1512112112122121.content:
You nod appreciatively at her suggestion. Though the smell could use work, Sandra smothering your body felt like the warmest, most comfortable blanket you could imagine. Surely a lot better than the often waterlogged rags you've been sleeping under in previous nights. The seal smiled and laid down her head next to you, seemingly getting ready to sleep as well. You can't quite see what she's doing, but you hear a deep and wistful sigh. Before your better judgment stops you, you speak up.

"Is everything alright?"

"Yeah, I'm fine... it's just..." Whatever she had on her mind, it wasn't something she wanted to put into words. It took some pushing from you to get her to elaborate.

"Being the only giant seal in this zoo makes the nights quite lonely. I've not felt someone else's warmth since the invasion started and they freed all the animals. I'm still not sure if I was lucky or unlucky to be the recipient of their experimental device. Sure, I can talk and I've grown big, but I'm all alone."

"Well, you've got me."
