You feared there would be many hours of waiting before she'd finally arrive, but to your surprise you could hear heavy footsteps after mere minutes. You were able to sneak in a quick glance and your heart jumped. It was exactly as planned. Just her, no guards. Now all you had to hope was that she hadn't seen you.

As she walked underneath the archway that concealed you there was one last moment to look down on your enemy. A towering skunk woman, dark-furred with deep blue stripes. Her ridiculously long tail swayed and swished around like it had a mind of its own. Finally she was directly below you. You grip the knife hard and without a word you drop down, ready to plunge it in her neck.

THWAP

You gasp as the tail whips out, catching you right in the gut and throwing you aside. The fierce impact knocks your weapon free, sending it across the building with a loud crash. You land back-first in the cloth awning of a hotdog stand, falling to the ground and gasping for air. You get up on all fours only to see the tip of the Queen's tail wrap around your left arm and pull you towards her. You scream in panic at the inhuman strength contained within the fluffy tail. She hoists you up by your arm, dangling you in front of her face.

"Oh, how cute. I'd heard reports of an immune little man hiding out here, but I didn't think you'd make it this easy to find you. Very brave to come at me with nothing more than your little sharpened stick, human." Her foul breath made your eyes water. Did she gargle sewage every morning? That smell could strip paint.

"I knew you wouldn't have the nerve to seek me out if I brought my guards along, but let's be honest, did you really think you stood a chance?" She gloated, laughing at your misfortune. "Now prepare to spend the rest of your days as my slave, little man. You shall serve me in whatever way I desire until I grow bored of you. Then I'll probably just eat you or give you to my guards as a toy. And there won't be a thing you can do about it..." Her tone got more menacing, but for the first time you had an answer ready.

"Wrong." You spat back at her bitterly, undoing the latch on your belt and grabbing the can of bear mace you'd taken from the zookeeper's office. You point it at her and before her tail can fling you away from her face you fire a large cloud of the stinging liquids right in her eyes.

"Aaaaaaaah!" She howled in pain, her tail releasing your arm and dropping you to the ground. You weren't going to wait around for another second. You didn't have anything that could inflict enough damage to kill her and you doubt she was going to just capture you now. You ran as fast as your legs would carry you. Volleys of cursing in an alien language echo behind you. Far more scarily though, heavy footsteps, a little shaky at first, rang out again. A glance over your shoulder revealed the Queen already on her feet. She wasn't about to let her prey get away that easy.
15121121121221211121111.title: Who's ambushing who again?

choices: You slip into a hiding spot, the raging Queen still nearby
151211211212212111211111.content:
You needed a hiding place and fast. If the Queen catches up with you there's no telling what horrors she'll inflict. Her footsteps thunder behind you, spurring you to run faster than you'd ever thought possible. Ahead was the arctic area. There were a few hidden spots that might provide shelter from the Queen's rage. The rainforest probably has more, but you were in no position to be picky right now. You charge along, hoping for the miracle it's going to take to escape her. You run past Sandra's enclosure, but you don't see the oversized seal anywhere. Maybe she's out exploring for food again. It's not like she'd be able to help you anyway, and you definitely don't want her to risk her life trying to protect you.

"You will pay for your insolence!" She roars, her booming voice closer to you than you feared. You need to do something or she'll grab you. On your left was the icy lake of Sandra's home and to the right a fake rock wall. Up ahead was a small food court with several employee entrances. They would be too small for the Queen to squeeze through, but you had to make sure she didn't catch you first.
151211211212212111211111.title: Run to the arctic zone

choices: The Rock Wall or The Food Court
1512112112122121112111111.content: Where exactly do you decide to go? Sandra’s icy exhibit might make for a good hiding spot, but you’d be freezing cold, and if Queen did find you… there wouldn’t be much you could do to escape from inside the exhibit. But the rock wall could work. It was outfitted for human-use and since Queen was much larger than a human it would be difficult for her to climb. But she could always shake the wall until you fall off into her open maw. And the food court could work.. but it was the farthest escape route. There isn’t much time for strategy… you can hear Queen stomping closer and closer. Better choose quick!
1512112112122121112111111.title: You slip into a hiding spot, the raging Queen s...

choices: She dangles you over her drooling maw, lunch time!
She carries you back to her ship, you’re her new servant
1512112112122121112111112.content:
You run as fast as your little legs could take you. You really wish you were a bit more athletic before this whole invasion. Too late now! You can hear Queen’s foot paws stomping on the ground, closer and closer and closer. Your chest heaves up and down as you gasp for more air to fuel your body. You notice a doorway up ahead that would be too small for Queen to fit through. You have to make it to that door! You’re so close. You try to pick up the pace a bit, but Queen’s shadow starts to swallow up your tiny little form. She’s right behind you now. Out of desperation, you squeal ‘help me’, hoping Sandra or someone would hear you. Unfortunately, it doesn’t really make much of a difference as Queen’s paw swings down and grabs you. Her digits clutch around the back of your shirt, yanking you backwards and off of the ground as she raised you up to her grinning muzzle.

Queen had a devious, yet pitiful look on her face. It reeked of a smug sense of victory, “So much for your great escape. I have half a mind to eat you right now.” You whimper and cower in her clutches, “P-please don’t eat me. I just wanna go home.” Her hot, nasty breath wafted on you. She tilted her head to the side and smirked at your quivering form, “Aw, what’s the matter? Sad you didn’t get to save the world?” You don’t answer, and continue to cower, embracing yourself for what must surely be your end. It was all starting to sink in; Queen won, the Earth was hers, it was all over. You wondered if you even really had a chance from the start. You whimper, “It’s not fair.” Queen cooed and smirked, pinching your cheek, “Oh, sweetheart… life’s not fair. Now… for your punishment!”
1512112112122121112111112.title: The Queen catches you

15121121121221211121111121.content:
She dangles you above her maw, which opened to reveal sharp teeth and strands of saliva. Her hot, rancid breath washed over you, causing you to go into a coughing fit as you were lowered closer....closer.....to her tongue. The giant muscles extended, slathering you in her hot, sticky saliva. You didn't think much of skunks as carnivores, but you couldn't help notice how sharp her teeth were.

Suddenly her tongue pulled back and her teeth snapped shut, and your life flashed before your eyes.... but you were unharmed. Her teeth had slashed through your clothes. She shook her head, tearing your clothes from your body, leaving you naked and ashamed. You begged for her to spare you, but she didn't even bother looking you in the eyes. You weren't worth the effort.

The Queen pushed you into her stinking maw, sliding you onto her tongue as her mouth closed around you. You were sloshed around, back and forth. It was so humid it was hard to breath. And then her tongue pushed you back, forcing you into her gullet. You were forced down her throat with a single gulp, as the muscles of her throat were all you could feel on your bare skin. There was no light. You would never see anything again. But you could hear the stomach growling beneath you as you neared it. Another squeeze of her throat forced the wind out of you, and let you go as you slid into the acrid stomach. Everything smelled like vomit. The acrid air caused you to cough. Your skin burns and your eyes itch. It wasn't long before you lose consciousness, and with you goes any hope of humanity's freedom.

The queen belched as she rubbed her stomach. "Well, I guess that means I win... not that it was ever really in question who would be victorious... I should probably make sure he didn't have any help. If he did, I could just eat them too~" she chuckled to herself as she headed back. "I hope the human doesn't give me gas.... actually, I hope he does. They would have hated it."
15121121121221211121111121.title: A Snack Fit For a Queen

choices: You thank Sandra for saving you life
You sprint towards Sandra, throwing yourself onto the seal in gratitude
You're a little terrified by the seal's immense voracity
1512112112122121112111113.content:
Suddenly your panicked fleeing was interrupted by an incredibly loud splash to your side, followed by a startled yelp from the Queen. You look behind you and see Sandra breaching out of the lake, soaring through the air and easily clearing the low fence on the side of her enclosure. Her newfound size meant her blubbery form probably had a few tons on the Queen and the towering skunk was about to meet them up close.

With a wet slap Sandra crashed into the Queen, her momentum carrying her along with almost no slowdown until she slammed into the fake rock wall. It was sturdier than you thought, but nonetheless big cracks radiated out from the point of impact. And what an impact it was. The sheer amount of mass thrown around shook the ground a little as the skunk's head and torso disappeared completely beneath the high velocity blubber. After smashing the Queen into the wall Sandra fell down with all the grace a large seal like her could manage, landing with a dull thump. Next to her was the skunk. She wasn't moving and you stop in your tracks. Did Sandra just...

"Are you okay, human?" She calls out to you. You start walking over to the seal and nod, still awestruck by the spectacle you witnessed.

"I heard the noise coming from outside and got in the water to hide. But then I saw you in trouble and I had to help. I think she's knocked out." She said, trying not to sound stressed.

"Then I think it's a great idea for us both to be gone before she wakes up again."

"No." She states sternly. You want to try arguing with her but she shuts you down. "It's easy enough for you to hide, but where am I gonna go? Or do you think she's gonna just let me go free without punishment for what I just did? I can't stop now."

"Well, what are you going to do then?" You asked incredulously.

Sandra didn't reply, instead wobbling over to the Queen's arm. Her bracelet looked made of complicated technology, but the seal didn't give a damn as she put it in her jaws and bit down, just enough to crunch the metal contraption. After that she spat out the drool-soaked but otherwise uninjured arm and several mangled scraps of alien electronics.

"That should stop her getting away." She mumbled to herself as she bounced her blubbery body over to the skunk's legs. You looked in disturbed awe as she opened her maw wide and swallowed both legs up to the knee. The giant seal gulped and gobbled like every second counted. Maybe she was right as you're fairly certain you could hear a bemused groan coming from the skunk. Was she waking up already? She was hardier than you thought, but she was also rapidly disappearing down Sandra's gullet. Already the seal's jaws were advancing along the skunk's waist, thick saliva matting the fur. You tried to help by wedging the skunk's limp arms in alongside her body. It was a difficult task and you only succeeded in bringing in one arm before Sandra had swallowed most of the Queen's torso.

The skunk became increasingly more lucid, her aching head wondering what the hell just crashed into her. But before she could do much more she saw the edges of her view filling up with rows of pointed teeth.

"Wait, what? No!" She cried out before Sandra closed her maw. Only her other arm was still sticking out, grasping desperately at the air whilst the seal gulped, sending the Queen down her throat. She slurped the arm up like a strand of spaghetti and with a final loud gulp she sealed the deal. The seal rolled onto her side, patting her now swollen belly. Even underneath all that blubber you could see the large bulge made by the oversized skunk. Sandra let out a satisfied burp, giving you a big smile.

"That's her taken care of. Now you didn't answer my question. Are you okay?"
1512112112122121112111113.title: Sandra intervenes!

15121121121221211121111131.content:
You stood there in awe as you watched the seal’s stomach jiggle and wobble about with Queen inside. You felt a lot of emotions… happiness, relief… and a bit of shame. After all of that fuss, after losing your parents, friends, town and more to the evil skunk… ultimately you were too puny to beat her, and if it weren’t for your companionship with Sandra, you might’ve been the one jiggling around in someone’s belly right now. You then hear Sandra’s voice, she waved a flipper at you, “Oh, human! Can you hear me?” You snapped out of it and nodded. You smiled at her, “T-thank you so much for saving me S-Sandra. I really owe you one. You just saved the world.”

The seal giggled, her belly sloshing about, before she ripped a nasty belch in your face. You scrunched your face up… her burp smelt like skunk spray. As you waved the stench away Sandra shot you a devious grin, “Perhaps later we could chat about my reward.” A chill ran down your spine. You did owe Sandra, big time. She just saved you and the world from the clutches of Queen, but you’d be lying if you said you didn’t fear what she’d ask of you as a reward. And you doubt you could weasel your way out of it, she’d saved your behind twice now. You look up through the cracks in the ceiling and remember the various alien spaceships floating in the sky. You wonder what’s going to happen now that the alien’s leader was disposed of.

Does this mean all of the humans under Queen’s spell were free? The jiggling and sloshing started to slow down, and eventually came to a halt. Queen had been vanquished and just died. Across the Earth, humans started to awaken from their mind controlled state… although most were in situations you wouldn’t want to wake up to, most were underneath or inside the butt of a curvy anthro babe. Although all of humanity was free from Queen’s magical pheromones, that didn’t necessarily mean they were freed from their fleshy booty prisons. In the control room of the mothership, a red light started flashing. A bottom-heavy horse woman swiveled in her chair and addressed a large Juggernaut, “Commander Viv, we’ve lost contact with Queen’s wrist communicator.” The huge green cat’s eyes widened, “That can’t be…”

Then, out of nowhere, the horse started to feel her human butt snack wiggling about in her bowels. She moaned and grinned, “Ooh, that’s heavenly.” She rubbed her underbelly, “Alright, you can stop now.” But the human didn’t stop, they fought harder. The horse clutched her belly, “HEY! I said cut it out. Why aren’t you listening to me?” The Juggernaut gasped, “The humans… they’re not under Queen’s spell anymore… that means…” A pear-shaped panther lady spoke up, “Is Queen dead?” The room erupted into chatter, one anthro asked, “Should we track down her signal… see what killed her?” The Juggernaut shook her head, “I’d rather not meet whoever or whatever could dispose of Queen. She was the apex of our kind.” The panther shrugged, “So… who gets to be Queen now?” A giddy tiger woman shot her paw in the air, “Ooh, ME!” “Who says you get to be Queen?” “Yeah, I should be Queen!” “Who do you think you are?” The mothership and the rest of the galactic fleet erupted into chaos.

The real question is… what happens from here?

Option 1: Without Queen’s stink to control the hordes of humans they’ve captured, the fleet dumps all of the captured populace back onto Earth, and vows to return in the future to claim the Earth. Only one problem, all of the animals are still much bigger, chunkier and can talk… and they’re not too keen on going back to normal. So life goes back to ‘normal’ or as normal as it can get with every animal on Earth being turned into a voracious female talking animal. Talking Animals now live alongside humans and can basically do whatever they want with you. It’s now just a fact of life that your lioness teacher can eat you or you could get sat on by an elephant simply for walking down the street. Will you be able to survive?

Option 2: Queen’s forces decide to cut their losses and head back to their home world with their droves of captured humans in tow. You have to go after them. Thankfully, as you see the ships starting to take off into the sky, you notice Queen’s space cruiser she used to pay you a visit at the Zoo. You jump into the ship and luckily for you, the ship is automatically set to return to the mothership before it is to take off into deep space. You still have a shot at saving the world, and you might even get a high-flying space adventure out of it… just try not to get eaten along the way.

Option 3: The anthro aliens decide against leaving the planet, and after the disappearance of Queen decide to dock their ships on Earth and set-up a permanent residency on the planet. They elect a new Queen and release all of the captured humans who were once under Queens control, under the condition that anthros will now have full control of the government. Life goes back to ‘normal’, but now anthros and talking animals ‘coexist’ alongside humans and are allowed to essentially do whatever they want with humans. They’ve entered every corner of society from business owners to teachers and beyond and make life as a human pretty gross, humiliating and dangerous.
15121121121221211121111131.title: You thank Sandra for saving you life

choices: Queen’s troops are trying to look for her
With Queen dead their invasion is over
15121121121221211121111132.content:
You were overcome with joy and relief that your big, chubby seal companion showed up in the final hour to save you. Without a second to waste, you charge Sandra and jump onto her blubbery form, wrapping your arms around her flab as best as you can. Being an animal, she didn’t smell good by any means, but you were more than happy to bury and nuzzle your face against her chub in this instance. The big bellied seal chuckled, “You’re happy to see me.” You giggle and nod as you snuggle into her blubber, “You bet. You saved my life.” Sandra grinned and opened her maw, ripping a noxious belch in your face.

You gag and groan, “Gross! What have you been eating?” Sandra smirked, “Well, evil aliens for one…” You both share a laugh as Queen continues to struggle inside the seal’s bulging belly to no avail. You looked down at the struggling and bulging form and poked it, almost intrigued by this turn of events. You always thought there was a higher chance of YOU getting eaten by Queen, than you seeing Queen get eaten. And just like that, her invasion was over. Just like that. It felt surreal. You look up to Sandra with a grin, “Thank you so much! I owe you one.” Sandra smirked back, licking her chops and winking at you, “YES you do.” You look up at the sky and notice some of the space ships are moving… they’re descending towards the ground. You point up to the sky to make Sandra look, “What’s that?” Sandra grumbled, “How should I know?” You get a bit nervous, “What do we do?” Why are the spaceships landing?
15121121121221211121111132.title: You sprint towards Sandra, throwing yourself on...

choices: Sandra has the aliens pack up and leave, saving mankind
Space Queen Sandra, that has a nice ring to it
Sandra asks for some time to think it over
151211211212212111211111322.content:
"Well, unless I'm mistaken, taking out the Queen will mean the end of the invasion." You tell the seal, a nervous grimace on your face.

"Are you sure?" She asks.

"Not really, but it's my best guess. I had planned to take her out with an ambush myself, but honestly I didn't really expect to get this far." You blush as you admit to Sandra.

"Well, if you're wrong, we're about to be swarmed by soldiers. So in case I don't get another chance..." She mutters before turning to face you and planting a large, sloppy kiss on your face. Her breath was fishy and nasty, with just a hint of the Queen's scent mixed in for good measure. But if she was right and this was your impending doom, you would spend these moments making her happy. You hold on as she deepens her passionate kiss, her large tongue going to town in your mouth. But as you were on the verge of fainting Sandra pulled back. If troops were going to come in, they should've been here by now. Instead she hears the approaching click of high heels.

Entering the arctic zone was just a single alien. It was one of the many anthro cats that had helped to subjugate humanity, but this one was dressed as a secretary. A tight-fitting two-piece suit with a pair of medals on her chest and a tablet in her arms.

"This was the location of the last known signal and ah... there you are. I see. The Queen has met her match." She noted something down on the tablet, watching the seal's belly move a little with their former leader's final struggles.You slide off of Sandra, letting her roll back onto her belly, squishing her prey and speeding up the inevitable. Both you and the seal looked at this strange administrator with suspicion. Before you could ask her a question she spoke up.

"As our laws dictate, whomsoever kills the Queen in combat will be awarded her position. Congratulations, you are the new leader of our little kingdom. There'll be some formalities to get through, but as of now you are the new ruler. It is within your right to refuse, and we will make a selection of suitable candidates ourselves."

"Can I just ask you to turn of the pheromone and put Earth on the list of planets never to be bothered again?" You ask the secretary.

"That should be possible, but undoing the pheromone would result in a sharp increase in violence all around the planet. Even if we were to all leave first, there's little chance for the unity we've provided to last." She explains calmly. You scoff at the idea that their concept of 'peace' and 'unity' involved making half of a species into mindless slaves.

"Do it anyway." You order, but the secretary seems a little more peeved now.

"I'm sorry, the reason I address you at all is because you seem to be our new Queen's trusted servant. Unless I'm mistaken it's her that has defeated the Queen." She points at Sandra.

The seal gets a look on her face like a deer in headlights. It starts dawning on her just how much she had potentially gained by eating that nasty skunk. All these aliens were ready to do her bidding. And with them, this whole planet could be made to serve her. And who knows how many more worlds. She could live in the lap of luxury for the rest of her days, and so could her little human friend. But when she looked down at you she saw concern in your eyes.

"Please don't... Don't do it, Sandra. Don't become just like the Queen. I wanted to free humanity, and when people learn it was you that set us free you'll be worshipped as a hero. You'll get all the food you could ever desire and I'll never leave your side." You plead, fearing the seal might be drawn towards the temptations of power. "But if you just become another alien ruler, everything I've done will be for nothing."

"When you accept your role, you will be given full control over the fleet and military. This planet and all its inhabitants will become yours to do with as you see fit. You may choose to live aboard our flagship or remain here if this planet holds a strong personal connection to you." The secretary adds, making the seal even more uncertain about what to pick. After a few minutes of milling over her options, Sandra finally has a response.
151211211212212111211111322.title: The Queen is dead, long live the Queen

1512112112122121112111113221.content:
Sandra looked down at your puppy dog expression with a look of sadness. Then a warm smile formed on her big lips. She looked up at the alien with a confident smile, “There will be no need. I wish for you aliens to leave the planet and release all of the humans in your custody.” You were elated, Sandra really was a good friend after all. You really owe her after all of this. You once again leap onto the huge seal, squeezing as much of her hide as you can, burying your face in her rubber skin, “Thank you, thank you, thank you.” The alien smiled nervously, “A-all of them? Can’t we keep a few for the ride home?” Sandra grimaced, “No! Those are my orders.”

The cat grimaced and rolled her eyes, “… Earthlings…” She turned away and seemed to phone the mothership on her wrist communicator. You and Sandra could hear more annoyed groans as the aliens chatted. The cat turned back to you two with a sarcastic grin, “Enjoy your little mud ball of a planet, Earthlings.” The cat stubbornly marched off before being teleported up, disappearing into thin air. You and Sandra look at each other with confused looks. What now? You both searched around the zoo for a vantage point to observe the alien ships. One-by-one they landed and started to unload their human cargo. Feeling a bit burnt by Sandra’s decision, the spiteful felines simply dumped their dazed human captives off by the dozens.

This same practice occurred all over the planet, depositing millions… even billions of humans back onto planet Earth. Many people would be displaced, confused and saddened by the loss of their loved ones to the churning bellies of the alien invaders, but the invasion was now officially over thanks to you, and mostly Sandra. You smile brightly as you see the ships fly up into the sky and use warp-speed to zoom into space, never to be seen again. Your happy moment is soon halted as you hear a monstrous fart blast out of Sandra’s backside, the foul seal fart enters your nose and burns your delicate nostrils.

Sandra groaned, “Oh god, aliens make me so gassy.” You pinch your nose as your eyes water, “Sandra! Gross!” The chubby seal chuckle, hip-checking you onto the ground, “Oh quit your complaining ya’ big baby, I saved the world. I think I can get away with a few farts.” Another bulbous blast rockets out of her backside, making the air thick and soupy, tasting of seal-butt. You groan smacking your lips, “I can taste it.” As you writhed on the ground, gagging in stinky agony, a thought occurred to you, “Sandra!?” The seal replied, “Yeah?” Nervously you ask, “You can still talk.” She furrowed her brow, “Yeah, of course I can. What’s the problem?” It started dawning on you, “Queen made all of the animals on Earth big, chubby females that could talk, right?” The seal nodded as you continued, “She never changed you guys back.”

Sandra grinned and chuckled, “Is that your problem? Ha-ha… for a minute I thought it was something serious. Yeah, we animals can talk now.” Sandra giggled and teasingly plopped herself next to you, poking you with a flipper, “Looks like you humans aren’t the only special ones that can talk and be smart anymore. Hope you don’t like eating meat, cause I can’t imagine a ten foot cow or a seven foot chicken would be too happy about it.” You nodded absentmindedly as this new information washed over you, “So… what’ll happen to the world now?” Whatever would happen, life would certainly never be the same. Every non-human animal on Earth was now a much larger, sentient female with voracious tendencies. And with Queen and her cat minions gone, this was assumedly irreversible. Sandra shrugged, “Beats me!?” What do you do now?

Option 1: You and Sandra explore the wreckage and find some of the abducted townsfolk. You’re reunited with your parents and you explain to your friends, parents and fellow townspeople what you and Sandra did to save the world. As you expected Sandra is hailed as a hero by your town, as civilization tries to start running again, and tries to incorporate huge talking female animals into everyday life.

Option 2: Time-skip to a few weeks or months later, society has rebuilt itself but has been changed forever. Now humans coexist alongside an animal population of huge, voracious talking female animals. It’s now fairly typical for humans to be eaten by their animal citizens, as well as snatched up to be toyed with. Talking female animals are in every part of normal life now and are teachers, artists, politicians, you name it. Humans are not allowed to be digested or physically harmed by their animal counterparts, but aside from that they have pretty reign. You’re still pretty good friends with Sandra, maybe even more-so than during the invasion, and she’s even introduced you to some of her fellow animal lady friends… they’ve also introduced you to their hungry stomachs and wide butts. How will you traverse a world filled with oversized, talking female animals?
1512112112122121112111113221.title: Sandra has the aliens pack up and leave, saving...

choices: Sandra wants to be even bigger
Sandra wants you to become able to survive being eaten
1512112112122121112111113222.content:
She remembered how the humans treated her before. An animal on display for them to coo at, a prisoner on a little island barely kept liveable and fed just enough to survive. She didn't have the intelligence before to recognize just how many corners her zookeepers were cutting. Gobbling them up was more satisfying than she'd ever admit to her human companion. He's shown her that kindness is certainly present among humanity, but she knew the truth. If she set everyone free, they'd appreciate her, possibly even reward her. But at the end of the day, she'd still just be an animal to them. No amount of newfound size or brains would convince them. She looked over to the secretary, who was patiently waiting for an answer.

"I'll do it. I'll become your queen." She said calmly. The cat nodded and began to tap busily on her tablet. Before you could speak, Sandra turned to you.

"I'm sorry, little guy, I know that you were hoping I wouldn't. But I want to make a difference for everyone like me. All the animals out there that were once locked away for your amusement. I promise I'll try to get the humans a better deal, if they deserve it."

"What do you mean, 'deserve it'? You just consigned a billion men to remain slaves to these monsters. Innocent men, just like me."

"You're too precious..." She pushed you into her blubber with a flipper, holding you against her smelly body. "...but you're an exception I'm afraid. Oh, that reminds me."

Sandra turned to the secretary. "First command, this human here is not to be harmed or abused in any way. He is mine and shall accompany me. Now let's see that flagship of yours."

"Certainly." She said in a cheery tone. She walked over to you and took your hand. "Please do not be alarmed." She spoke with a soothing voice, but you didn't trust her one bit. A strange tingling surrounded your arm and when you looked at it you had a wristband on that wasn't there before. "This will let you access our teleportation network. I'm afraid we'll have to modify one to fit you, my queen."

"No problem, now beam us up." She said with barely restrained glee. A bright light surrounded all three of you and suddenly the floor went missing. For a second you were suspended in thin air before your feet met with the metallic tile of the Queen's throne room. Already her large throne was being dismantled and any paintings of her taken off the walls. There was even a cat guard with a fumigator walking around to clear away the smell.

"We'll need some guidance on how you would prefer your throne room to look, but that can happen in due time. Right now I need to know what you have in mind for this planet. We can keep the pheromone going if you desire or we can slowly taper it off. I doubt all the men who've been subjected to our whims will appreciate it though and the ensuing conflict would harm a number of your subjects."

You stare at her, incredulously. You had heard of the animals doing terrible, disgusting things to their slaves. You had never expected to just be doing manual labor. “O-okay. I guess that doesn’t sound so bad…” you stutter.

“No hold on now! That’s just the work you’re going to be doing for me. I imagine the other gals around here will have very different jobs in mind for ya,” she says with a laugh. You shudder. It was just as you had feared; you didn’t just have one ‘master’, you’re going to be a plaything for the entire zoo. “But nevermind that now. You should get settled in.” Before you could say anything, she gently takes you hand and leads you down the winding, messy corridors of the immense building. Eventually, she shepherded you into an abandoned office, which had apparently been turned into a makeshift bedroom.

“Ol' Suberiwa set up this room for herself long ago, but she had to be… evicted,” the gazelle explains cryptically. “So… I guess it’s your’s now! You must be tuckered out after travelling so far, poor little thing. You should get some rest.” You stepped into the room hesitantly, at her behest. The bed didn’t look quite as good as your old one, but it definitely looked more comfortable than any of the other places you’ve slept in recently. You even had a beautiful view of the savannah through the windows. “By the time you’re up, I'll have dinner ready, and we can introduce you to the rest of the girls. Such a big day!” She immediately left you to your bearings, trotting down the hallway in an excited haze. You listened to her hoof steps slowly disappear down the hallway… and, once you were sure she was gone, collapsed on the dirty old bed, exhausted.

You stare at the ceiling, taking the alone time to think. You could probably take this opportunity to sneak out, but… to be honest, searching for the queen had become quite exhausting, and you’ve felt so lonely all these months. Something about the gazelle lady just seemed so… motherly and comforting. Maybe these animals weren’t all that bad...
15131.title: Refuge from the Jungle

choices: Unbeknownst to you, a bird was directly overhead
You spot a towering bird up ahead
15132.content:
You decide to head towards a building with a dome, just because it looked different from other buildings. You snuck through the streets and entered, carefully closing the door behind you. When the door shut, you heard a distinct clicking noise. Worried, you decided to try and open the door again. It locked behind you. You'd be stuck here until you find the controls to the locks.

You went to one of the hallways, and began trekking forward, straight into a rainforest area. It felt muggy and smelled funny. You cautiously looked around, occasionally hearing chirps, the flapping of wings, and the shifting of branches. You were worried about whether or not you'd run into one of Queen's aliens.

151322.content:
Looking ahead, you spy some giant birds. They looked like supermodels, save for the feathers, wings, and beak. It looked like they transformed the whole rainforest area from an exhibit to a sort of park. Bars were bent into vague bench shapes. Each stood at least 10 feet tall, easily standing well over you. You looked around.

On one "bench," you noticed a blue and yellow macaw, who looked like she was swearing eye-shadow and blush. Her eyes seemed to sparkle with an alluring pull. Her thighs were thicker than your arms, and she looked like she could bench at least 300 ibs. with her muscles. For some reason, she was wearing an inviting smile.

Elsewhere, you saw two beings resembling rainbow lorikeets. They each stood at 12 feet tall, looked like they fought for a living, and looked ready to beat down on the next person they saw. They seemed a lot more slender than the macaw, but they still looked powerful. Their breasts were the size of beach balls, and they could easily break stone with a butt drop.

Curious, you crawled towards the macaw. As you got close, you began to realize how giant she was. She already looked like she could lift a car halfway off of the ground from afar, but she was even bigger up close. Her back muscles looked like they could grind meat if you rubbed some on them. Good lord they looked sharp. Her massive upper body was supported by equally massive legs. You were correct in assuming the legs were thicker than your arms, but you underestimated just how thick they were. You were sure a single thigh was almost half as wide as your body.

The hue of her feathers, blue and yellow, worked together to be hypnotic. Speaking of hypnotic, you couldn't help but look up at her eyes. Her sclera was amber colored, and they were just as pretty as her feathers. You couldn't help but look at them for ages. Then, you began to realize that, if you could see her eyes, then maybe she could see you! Could you hide before she noticed you?
1513221.title: Examine the blue and yellow macaw

15133.content:
You kept sneaking forward and came up to the reptile house. The building looked old and forlorn even before the aliens showed up. Now that the zoo was almost completely abandoned it looked even more out of use. You figure it would be perfect for a hideout. Whatever animals lived in there probably all escaped already. You open the double doors and immediately the atmosphere stops you in your tracks. The air was very musty, like no janitor had dusted the place for ten years. Secondly the interior was surprisingly warm. And this was just the entryway. On the walls were informative posters about reptiles and snakes and ahead was a second set of double doors leading to the enclosures. You carefully pushed them open and walked in. The strange smells in the air tripled in strength and the heat was overbearing. All the lights and heat lamps were evidently still on. More curiously was what had happened to the enclosures. The thick glass panes that would separate the animals from the guests had all been removed. Not broken, but simply gone. There wasn't a splinter of glass on the floor. Sweat began to form on your brow as you pressed on, looking for food and shelter.

From one of the largest enclosures a pair of eyes peered at you. You looked around for a door leading to wherever the zookeepers kept their stuff. You were feeling uneasy about the situation. Your initial thoughts of shelter wavered. Not only was this place too hot for you, there was something... off about it. You couldn't put your finger on it precisely, but there was something in the air. It made you shiver a little. The odd smell began to get up your nose. It was probably just one of the plants. You reach a small junction when you hear a twig snap behind you. You turn around on the spot and stand face to face with...
15133.title: Head towards the reptile house.

151331.content:
You leapt in terror as you saw the lizard woman. She managed to sneak up right behind you and immediately closed the distance again. She grabbed your wrist and looked you in the eye. "Slow down, little drudge-man. Didn't mean to scare you..." You had a moment to look at her. She stood a little bit taller then you at a solid 6 feet. Her skin was made up of a fine mesh of dark green scales. Vibrant black, white and yellow patterns darted along her arms and legs. She wore a small skirt and a tank top. The top completely failed to contain a set of scale-covered breasts. Her head was mostly reptilian. A scaly snout with piercing white eyes. In lieu of hair she had a series of scaly ridges patterning the top of her head. A large forked tongue flicked out for a moment before retreating back past her lips.

"There you go. All is good. Did you get lost? You really shouldn't wander off all by yourself." She stepped even closer, walking right up to you. She leans her face near your ear and whispers. "You never know who you might run in to..." You gulp loudly, making her giggle. She leans back only a little. "Oh, I won't bite..." You let out a small sigh of relief.

"... much." In a flash she pulled up your arm and snapped her maw around it. Her needle-like teeth sting as they pierce you, but as soon as it started the lizard woman already spat out your arm. Your heart is racing, your mind desperate to catch up to what the hell just happened. You look at your arm and see two small round wounds. Then they split up into four. You begin to see double as the voice of the lizard woman echoes from some unknown distance.

"I probably should've mentioned I'm venomous..."

What effect does her poison have on you? Does it paralyze you or send you into a hallucination-filled fever dream? Is it an aphrodisiac causing uncontrollable arousal in you? Or does it do something else alltogether?
151331.title: a lizard alien.

Your jaw nearly hits the floor when it then starts introducing itself, revealing it can talk. You're staring at an oversized, talking...

1513331.content:
"Hello little man, I am Bear. Yesss, I know. My keepers had a weird sssense of humor. who do I have the pleasssure of meeting?" You're too busy picking your jaw back up from the floor to reply. The snake was patterned with a bland pattern of greens and browns. It did a phenomenal job in hiding just how much of it there was. Your eyes follow the body, seeing coil after coil after length hidden in the brush. At their widest the coils are about as wide as a truck's wheels and the length you can only guess at. In spite of the name, Bear sounded like a female. Though you didn't really have much of a reference when it came to talking snakes. It has not eluded the snake that you are staring at her formidable body.

"Impressssive, is it not? One day I just sssstarted growing and it sssimply did not stop. Then I found out I could ssspeak too. Everybody had already left by then, and my cage was getting quite... conssstraining. But asss luck would have it, the next day I woke up and all the glassss was gone. The othersss all left, but not me. I sssstay and wait." It sounds like the aliens took pity on the sight of this oversized snake cooped up in a cage and removed all the glass. Though that does leave you with a burning question. How do you react to this huge snake? She appears to be friendly for now.

"How about you? What'sss got you wandering into my house?"
1513331.title: snake

choices: Tell her your story, and include your journey to defeat the queen
Tell her your story, but don't mention your goals
15133311.content:
Your instincts screamed at your to flee, but you were too shocked and terrified to even move a muscle, much less break into a sprint. Besides, the serpent is so unimaginably large compared to you that any move you could make to defy her would be futile. Now that she has you in her sights, you could only hope to placate the giant snake, and pray that her intentions are pure. She didn’t really seem malevolent, though she had a strange, mischievous glint in her eyes, as if she might be toying with you.

“I-I’m sorry, miss… Bear. I didn’t know you already lived here…” you mutter, your voice shaking as stare at the overgrown floor, trying to avoid looking in her piercing serpentine eyes. Bear seems amused by your nervousness. “I was j-just searching for a place to stay…” The second those words left your mouth, you knew you had made a mistake.

“Aww… sssuch a poor little human… all alone in the big, ssscary world,” Bear titled her head, feigning sympathy. At this point, you knew she was toying with you, but you couldn’t tell if she was dangerous or not. “You can ssstay with me all you like, little one. I will take goood care of you…”

You flinch, making motions for the door. “Oh, no thank you! I-I wouldn’t want to impose or anything…” you say, before hearing a faint slithering behind you. You turn, to realize with horror that the serpent had completely blocked off the doorway with her tail. You were trapped.

“Oh, no, no, no! I insssissst...” Bear smirked smugly, not dropping her seemingly friendly demeanor even as she loomed over you. “It’s been ssso lonely around here. I could certainly appreciate having an adorable human around to… entertain me...”

You weren’t particularly afraid of snakes, normally, but this was all just too much. As the powerful serpent led you away from the door, and you realized how hopeless your situation was, you couldn’t hold in your emotions any longer. The snake dropped her smug act for a second, grimacing when she saw tears start to stream down your face. “You mammals aren’t very sssubtle, are you? Always wearing your heart on your sssleeve. Well, calm your beating little quadripartite heart,” Bear insisted, with a not-quite-reassuring air of superiority. “I shan’t be planning on turning you in. I’m not particularly fond of the aliens, myssself. If I shared your primitive sssense of sssmell, I would likely consider them quite foul...”

You rub your arm nervously, finding it difficult to judge the intentions of the serpent. “S-so you’re not…” you stutter. “... hungry?”

“We shall crossss that bridge when we come to it!” Bear said, in a surprisingly jovial tone. She pulled your body closer to her with her tail, cuddling you against her warm scales. “Now, tell me. How did a rogue little human like you hold out for so long? You don’t look particularly sssmart or capable… no offense….”

You consider the situation for a moment. You had been hoping to find some sort of weapon to fight against the queen… could this be the opportunity you were hoping for? Bear didn’t seem to like the aliens very much, and at her size, she could probably defeat the queen easily. Perhaps you could recruit her to your cause...
15133311.title: Trussst in Me

choices: Bear joins your cause... for now.
151333111.content:
With a small sigh of relief you open your heart to the snake. You tell her all about the invasion, how the aliens overthrew every nation on Earth in a span of days. You mention the pheromone and Bear nods intently as you describe its effects. "Yesss, that does ssseem to match what I've ssseen the last few daysss. You humansss are already so ssslow, but ever since the invasssion you all dropped to a new low. No complaintsss from me though. Food hasss never been easier to find." You gulp a little. Bear never gave you a straight answer on the eating front, which you kind of expected. It's still quite unsettling. You clear your throat and continue talking. Your immunity causes her to perk up for a second, curious about what made you so special.

Next you tell Bear the reason you're here. Your mission to stop the Queen. The huge snake snorts with laughter. "You? Ssstop the Queen? Hahahaha, you humansss always had a funny sssense of humor." Smugly, she continues. "There'sss no chance you can ssstand up to her. Your whole planet fell to her might in daysss. What is one little man going to do?" You rub your brow heavily. Were you a bold man, you could consider asking Bear to join your cause. But the snake might not be too interested in getting involved. On the other hand, she's one of the first creatures you've met that didn't instantly want to eat or enslave you. That had to count for something. Cold sweat ran down your back. If you misjudged the situation, Bear would have you wrapped in coils and at her mercy in an instant. No, this opportunity was too great. She could be your golden ticket to beating the Queen once and for all.

You stood there, lost in thought. Only when you felt a wet, forked tongue brush against your face did you snap back to attention. "Isss everything alright, mighty warrior?" She said, stifling another fit of laughter. You put on your brave pants and reply. "I don't have a plan yet to beat the Queen, but I hope you might be interested in helping me."

Bear's head lifted in wicked curiosity. "Why would I help you?" You knew she would ask that and began you impassioned plea. "Because these aliens are taking away all the humans, leaving none for you. If we take out the Queen, they'll leave us alone. And besides, don't you want to know what an alien queen tastes like? I can be your ticket to getting to her. Simply pretend to hand me over and demand she comes out here. You do what you do best and put her in your belly. Everyone will be so happy with you for saving the planet, they'll do whatever you want." Bear's mind reeled with possibilities. She could be the saviour of Earth. A fitting title for a great snake like her. There was always time to eat the little human afterwards.

On the other hand she quite liked her little cozy life in here. If this struggle with the Queen didn't go as planned, she could stand to lose a lot. Though she didn't like the aliens, she did have to concede that her ability to speak and increased size were very nice. Then there's the human's plan. Why pretend to turn him in if she could just turn him in for real? The Queen would probably shower her in luxury. She might even offer a steady supply of pheromoned humans as food. The mere idea made her salivate a little.

The huge snake was in a bind. Would she help you to sate her huge ego? Or would she betray you and earn a queen's bounty? Or should she bother at all with these aliens and just eat the little man instead?
151333111.title: Tell her your story, and include your journey t...

choices: "Turn yourssself in to Queen, tell her I ssssent you."
1513331112.content:
The decision wasn't exactly a hard one for Bear to make. Back some random human boy, or an entire race of human-enslaving aliens? That said, she wasn't going to just let you go, not when she could use a situation like this to her advantage! She gave you a friendly smile, and nodded her massive head. "Of coursssse I'll help you, human. After all, I have a sssspecial ability that's ssssure to come in handy. Would you like to ssssee what it is?"

Against your better judgement, you decide to trust Bear here, and say, "of course! I'd like to know what my new partner can do before we battle the aliens!"

Bear chuckles softly, and brings her face close to yours. "Gooood. Now all you have to do...is look into my eyessss..." You do so, and are shocked as her serpentine eyes erupt with bright rings of gorgeous colors! You've never seen anything like this! You don't want to look away! You feel her scaly tail slide up your leg, but when you try to see what she's doing, you find that you literally can't look away!

A confused look appears on your face as Bear's tail continues its climb up your leg. It reaches the waistline of your shorts, and gets to work undiong them as you stammer out a, "w-what are you...d-do...ing?"

Your pants flop to your ankles, and Bear chuckles, "you mean you haven't figured it out?" She brings her eyes even closer until you can't see anything but those...pretty colors... "My sssspecial ability...isss hypnosssisss..."

Hypnosis!? She's hypnotizing you!? This isn't good, you need to get away, but...her eyes are...so pretty. You try to run, but your legs don't respond. You hardly even notice when she shucks off your underwear and wraps the tip of her tail around your weiner. She starts stroking it, and you let out a soft whimper that makes her laugh.

"It feelssss good, doesn't it? It'll feel even better if you jussst sssstop resssissting..." Your willpower slips a bit as she says that. This does feel...really good. Your pupils shrink down, and your mouth hangs open as your eyes start to mimic hers. Your now erect cock twitches as you're submerged in hypnotic bliss. The more you stare, the more the rest of the universe fades away. All you care about is those eyes...and how good they make you feel! As your cock erupts with creamy cum, the last of your resistance fades. A goofy grin appears on your face, and your mind is empty of everything except those colors. Bear stops her spell. "Good, now that you're under my control..."

You felt yourself moving, the large tail of the snake was wrapped around your leg and dragging you back towards her. She leans in with a disappointed frown and sighs. "That wasss very rude, young man." The snake chides. A heavy mass rubs against your legs as the coils holding you recede. You look down but the snake snaps you to attention. "I'm up here! Now, if you want to leave, at least be polite enough to asssk." Not wanting to piss off the giant snake further you play along. "Miss Bear, could I please leave? Humanity is counting on me to defeat the aliens." Her answer was quite unexpected.

"Alwaysss in such a rush. You mussst learn to ssslow down from time to time." More weight brushed against your legs. "Here, let me ssshow you." In a flash your legs were pushed together by her large body. The snake had sneakily wrapped some of her thickest coils around your legs. A single loop was enough and a second one was laid on top to surround most of your torso. You didn't even have time to flail with your arms before they were bound tightly to your body. The wobbly column of human and snake fell over, Bear's body effortlessly absorbing the impact. You were on your side with immensely heavy serpentine coils trapping you up to your shoulders. One last coil was added, this one neatly wrapped around your head. The snake had you constricted in her huge body from head to toe. What followed was a...
15133312.title: You've seen enough movies to know what to d...

choices: You’re in the cafeteria, and lunch doesn’t seem to be agreeing with these women
You’re in the gymnasium, time for some sweaty sports and workouts
152.content:
You decide to head for the school, you’ve heard rumors that the Queen was going to make that her new home base, only second to her mothership. If that was the case then going to the school was your best shot at finding her… it was also your best shot at ending up as some girls booty cushion or an alien snack. So you have to proceed with caution. You exit the dumpster and sprint as quietly as you can towards the school.

You’re not quite sure where the main entrance is so you pick the first door you can find. You quietly open the door and shut it. Turning around you see where you’ve ended up in the school, and it’s not good. This place is swarming with anthro and human women… but where are you exactly?
152.title: The school

choices: You make a break for it!
You pass out from the smell!
1521.content:
The school was nothing like you remember it. None of the lights functioned, leaving its interior ominously dark and desolate. Debris were draped across the cafeteria; doors ripped from their hinges, tables flipped, decorations scattered upon the floor. In the darkness, you can vaguely make out the movement of limbs, gnarled green furs, and twisted forms that seem to move and writhe unnaturally.

You stood there for a second, unable to comprehend what you were seeing, until your eyes adjusted to the darkness. Then, you saw them -- sitting at the tables of the cafeteria were over a dozen alien/animal women! You had never seen so many in one place before!

You immediately rush for cover, hiding behind a counter on the other side of the cafeteria. You sit there for a while, holding your breath, but luckily, it seemed none of them had spotted you. As you sit in your hiding spot, you curse yourself for having been so reckless, wandering right into the alien’s base of operations! You look at your watch, and realize why there was so many aliens in the cafeteria.

It was dinner time.

This must be where they come to eat! You were now trapped with a bunch of hungry alien women! You couldn’t rush back to the exit, you would be spotted for sure. You just had to wait for them all to leave.

You curiously peek out of your hiding place, watching them as they sat around talking. You had rarely seen the animal women up close and personal before. Half of them were green, feline women with long tails, but there were also women that resembled horses, cows, reptiles, canines… everything you could imagine. Just like real animals, they were covered in fur, had snouts and tails, and ran the gamut in height from 6 to 12 feet.

Some of the animal women were thin and sylphlike, while some were more curvy and plump. But even though their physiques varied, their bodies were all comparable to supermodels, with flawless bodies and hourglass figures dominated by their humongous breasts and booties. They looked like they must have been genetically designed for beauty, as they were more bewitching than most any human women you’ve ever seen.

As you watched them sit around, talking and laughing with each other, you couldn’t help but grow to find them surprisingly attractive. But you tried to ignore those feelings -- they were evil aliens, after all, and wouldn’t hesitate to drag you back to their weird spaceship.

As your eyes adjusted to the darkness, you noticed that all their bellies seemed huge, like they had all stuffed themselves to the brim. The women seemed content rubbing their own bellies, as their bellies writhed and undulated, as if something was moving around inside their stomachs. You were confused about this for a moment, but turned your attention when another cat lady emerged into the room.

The woman was dressed up like a stereotypical chef, and was carrying one of those giant trays in her hand. You gasp when you saw one of the school’s students lying on the tray, restrained so he couldn't run away or speak. “Your meal, madame,” the cat lady announced, presenting the tray to a tall, chubby crocodile woman.

“About time!” the crocodile woman complains, frustrated she got her dinner last. You watch in horror as the woman picks up the student on her tray, and yawns open her immense crocodile jaws, placing the boy’s foot on her tongue near the back of her mouth. He wriggles futilely as he stares down the woman’s throat, and shudders in disgust as she lets out one massive belch directly onto his face.

The tall crocodile woman easily holds the boy’s sides as she maneuvers him around until his toes are touching the back of her throat. She takes a swallow with one massive gluk, and her powerful throat muscles immediately latch onto his feet, most of his legs disappearing into her throat with a single swallow. You watch in terror and awe as the woman takes another swallow. Now, he was up to his waist in her tight, dark throat, and the rest of his body was lying on his tongue.

The woman seemed to swallow him down easily, acting like it was no big deal, like she was just eating a hamburger or something. She had obviously done this many times before. The boy seemed disgusted by the small of her meaty, swamp breath, and the thick, sticky saliva that covered most of his body.

With another swallow, only his head remained outside of her throat. You saw his face at the back of her mouth, and marveled at the sight of her throat bulging to seemingly impossible proportions. She paused for a few minutes, letting the boy have one last glimpse at the outside world before taking another swallow, plunging him into darkness.

You gasped quietly as you watched the boy get dropped into the crocodile woman’s stomach. Her belly stretched and extended easily to accommodate for its new ‘guest’, and you could clearly see the outline of her prey’s body as he squirmed around. “Mm! You cats are right -- kids are the most delicious snack in the universe,” she says, as she pats her huge belly.

You realize that every single alien woman in this cafeteria had a student squirming around in their belly, and they all were laughing and chatting as they teased and digested their ‘dinner’. This must be what the aliens eat! You had always wondered about that. “But I wish he wouldn’t wriggle so much. It always gives me--” before she can say it, you can audibly hear a wet fart break free from the woman’s massive derriere.

As you heard this, you suddenly realized how disgusting the room smelled. These aliens were flatulent enough, but their ‘dinner’ must double their gassiness. The whole room was filled with over a dozen huge women who were constantly farting and belching, as they futilely massaged their sore stomachs. The cacophony of farts and gas immediately invaded your nostrils, and made you light-headed.

You duck back into hiding, trying to process what was going on. You again considered making a break for the door. You didn’t know how much longer you could stand this smell -- if you stayed here much longer, you might pass out.

Then again, if you get caught while trying to escape… well, it was dinner time, and YOU were on the menu!
1521.title: Feeding Frenzy

choices: She opens wide, you’re as good as cat food
She brings you to the mothership to be interrogated by Queen
15211.content:
The thick cloud of stink is nearly suffocating to you, you’re going to have to get out of here soon or you’ll probably going to succumb to their toxic farts. With no other options but to run you peak out from the counter to see when the alien women are especially occupied. They seem to be wrapped up in rubbing the distended, squirming guts at the moment and talking about their tasty ‘dinners’. It looks like it’s now or never. You dart out from behind the counter, but it sounds like they’ve noticed you. You hear from behind you, “Hey is that a kid”, “Is he spying on us”, “Looks like he’s trying to escape… get him!”

Your legs pump, your heart beats through your chest, your blood rushes, you can make it. Your simply feet away from the double doors to freedom. You’ve got this, you’ll make it! Woops! You don’t got this. You trip on a stray wooden beam, probably once belonging to a lunch table, acquainting your face with the ground. A cow woman and the croc lady from before nearly slam themselves into the double doors, swiftly shutting and looking them. The two them firmly plant themselves in front of each door, smugly grinning down at you, blocking your way out. Now, two metal doors and probably over a thousand pounds of fat, hungry alien women stood between you and freedom.

To make matters worse when you got up and turned around you are greeted with a terrifying sight, a horde of grinning alien women, forming a complete circle around you, trapping you. Soon enough you feel something grab you, you turn to see a horse lady grabbing your arm and pulling you towards her, she speaks in a southern accent, “Hey darlin’, wanna see what the inside of a horse looks like?” You feel someone grab your other arm, a hyena woman, “Geez, you look awfully cold. Wanna warm up inside my stomach?” Then a shark woman steps up, looking angrily at the hyena, “Hey I saw him first!” A rhino woman chimes in, “No, he’s my snack.”

The alien women break out into an angry frenzy, arguing over who will get to gulp you down. All of the arguing stops once someone yells, “Enough!” Everyone turns to see the green cat lady from before approaching you. She addresses the other aliens, “All of you have already had your meals, and I’ve been working all night to prepare them for you.
