It was almost serene. “Well, the mall was fun,” the gator smiled. “What else do you want to check out?” You were surprised that she still had so much energy, but you did want to enjoy the day with her as much as possible. You considered it for a while, thinking about all your favorite places from back when the city still thrived...
15533321121221.title: A Healthy Meal

15533322.content:
You search through the nearby dumpster in desperation, until you finally find your salvation -- an old, thick rug! An idea leaps to your mind, and you toss the rug up on top of the barbed wire, allowing you to scale the fence without getting cut too badly. You climbed the steel fence as fast as you can, hearing one of those feline aliens approach rapidly down the alleyway. "Human! Get back here!" she yelled, startling you and causing you to fall to the ground on the other side of the fence, cutting your ankle on the barbed wire in the process. At least you took the rug down with you. "No! Don't go in there! For your own good, stay out of that park!" For some reason, the alien's voice sounded... genuinely frightened. As if she was actually concerned for your safety. You didn't trust her, though, so you ignored her advice. Still bleeding from your ankle, you fled deeper into the amusement park you had suddenly found yourself in. After a few minutes of confusion, you realize -- this was the amusement park you always used to go to, back when you were a kid! You didn't know this place was still around!

Wait a second... this place isn't supposed to still be around. It got dismantled years ago! And yet, here it was, exactly as you remembered it. This can't be possible. Something strange was going on here.

Still, this wasn't the time for paranoia. Your ankle was bleeding pretty bad. Maybe there was a medical station somewhere in the park?
15533322.title: Try to climb the fence

155333221.content:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gshBY5ZzWpw

The further into the amusement park you explored, the more foreboding it seemed. Especially as the sun sets, and it grows steadily darker. It was completely abandoned, of course, and eerily silent even compared to the rest of the city. The park was obviously poorly maintained, and most the buildings were dirty and overgrown. Every once in awhile, you can even hear whispers… but you dismiss it as the sound of the wind.

Luckily, you found a map, but you had to plan out your course of action before it got too dark. There were two First Aid stations marked on the map; one in the west side of the park, and the other in the far east. There didn’t seem to be any difference, so it was really just a matter of preference.
155333221.title: Creepy Amusement Park

1553332211.content: You decide to head west… only to find the debris of a massive, collapsed roller coaster have blocked your path! You couldn’t hope to climb over the debris with your wounded ankle. For a moment, you consider giving up and going to the east station… until you realize there are other ways around the debris. If you make your way through the roller coaster station, you might be able to just walk through the dark forest where the coaster once stood. Of course, that might be a little dangerous. Judging by the map, there’s also an emergency exit on the other end of the haunted house attraction… but that place might get a little creepy.
1553332211.title: Head West

15533322111.content:
You walk over to the abandoned roller coaster, now far beyond repair. The station was dark and empty ▼
https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736...
, the coaster itself sitting eerily empty on the tracks, never to hold passengers again. A bit of a shameâ¦ you used to love this thing when you were younger. You climbed over the tracks, only to find that the grassy field where the elegant roller coaster once stood was now an overgrown forest, pine trees reaching up towards the full moon; the only thing lighting your path through the dark forest. It was a beautiful sight, if a bit ominousâ¦

You trudged through the dark forest, constantly looking over your shoulder. Though you knew even the wildlife had abandoned the city, you couldnât help but feel like you were being watched. From the outside, the forest area seemed very small; you figured it would only be a few dozen meters to make it to the other side. However, after walking in a straight line for longer than you could keep track, you didnât seem to making any progress at all. Alone in the dark wilderness, you began to panic. Were you lost? Was this forest bigger than it first appeared? Perhaps, in the darkness, you had wandered in circles?

Just as you were trying to calm down and think rationally, a sound in the distance shook your senses. A howl! Somewhere nearby, a wolf was howling! Your blood ran cold. This couldnât be possible. You thought all the wildlife had been forced out by the aliens. You started walking a little faster through the dark, fear overtaking your common sense. You knew wolves didnât normally attack humans, but after going this long without food, you wouldnât be surprised if one had gotten desperate.

A few minutes later, you hear the wolf howling again, but this time it sounds slightly closer. This continued a few times, with each howl coming closer and closer no matter how fast you ran. You had been running in a straight line for half an hour now, and the rest of the park was nowhere to be seen. You were completely lost in the wilderness, stranded with a savage predator that was definitely following you. You were running so quickly that your foot eventually collides with a tree root that had been obscured by the darkness, sending you landing flat on your face on the ground.

You groan and cough, temporarily disoriented by your fallâ¦ only to hear something growling just a few meters behind you. You flip onto your back to face your pursuer, but instead of seeing a regular wolf, you lay eyes on a eight-foot tall creature standing on two legs, with humanoid features but a wolfâs snout and glowing yellow eyes. It seemed to be covered in recently torn scraps of clothing, which failed to cover the creatureâs large, furry breasts. You had seen anthropomorphic animals before, but this one seemedâ¦ different. Like the glimpse of humanity there was being suppressed by pure animalistic rage.

âRunâ¦â The creature yelled, in a deep, booming, but still distinctly feminine voice. For a moment, you stared at her like a deer into headlights, awed by the sight of the huge, untamed creature. It was snarling and shaking violently, as if she was trying to hold herself back. âRunâ¦ I canât stop myselfâ¦!â The wolf creature took a step towards you, and that was all that was needed to knock you out your stupor. You flip over and pull yourself to your feet as fast as you can.

You can hear the creatureâs huge paws chasing behind you, sometimes even feeling her warm breath at the back of your neck. Your adrenaline rush propels you through the forest just fast enough to evade her, but not without several close calls. You can tell you werenât going to be able to keep this up for long; she was much faster than you, and sooner or later, she would have you cornered. Luckily, you spot a strange cabin in the woods just up ahead. It's far away, but maybe you can make it...
15533322111.title: The Werewolf

15533322112.content:
The old "haunted house" attraction looked just as cheesy as you remembered it from your childhood, although its run-down, abandoned look made it slightly creepier now. The haunted house was designed to be fun for the whole family, so you don’t remember it being particularly scary, just fun. Feeling nostalgic, you wander in the front door.

You walk through the halls of the house, remembering most of it. Usually, people in creepy costumes would be jumping at you right now… but of course, the house was empty, and deathly silent, which was almost creepier. Since there was no electricity, it was scarily dark inside the building, and you couldn’t really make out any details of the hallway; you just had to rely on your memory. Just as you were getting comfortable in the darkness, something suddenly with glowing red eyes suddenly burst out from a wall, screaming at you!

“Oh FUCK!” you screamed, jumping back, prepared to defend yourself… only to realize it was a false alarm. It was just an animatronic! “Damn it...” You shake the sweat from your head, your heart still beating. You forgot this place had animatronics. You didn’t know exactly how they worked with electricity, and you didn’t want to question it. You just wanted to get out of here as fast as possible.

You wandered the hallways of the haunted house for a half an hour, getting increasingly confused. It wasn’t supposed to be this big. Were you just walking in circles? You became more and more desperate for an exit as the darkness swallowed you, and the constant silence was occasionally interrupted by the screech of an animatronic ghost. As the stumbled through the darkness, you could swear you were starting to hear whispers, but you dismissed them as your mind playing tricks on you. You were also starting to catch glimpses of a strange blue light out of the corners of your eyes, and what sounded like tapping on the walls. At this rate, you might walk out of here completely mad…

Panicking, you sit down, leaned up against a wall, trying to get your bearings. After a few moments of silence, you heard another whisper again, this one louder and clearer than any of the ones that came before. “Get… out…” a loud, croaking voice said, its inflection full of hate. You turn around in an instant, only to vaguely catch sight of a blue specter before it disappeared. Now, you were more terrified than ever. Certainly, what you just saw couldn’t possibly be real… but it seemed clear as day! You ran through the hallways as fast as you could, but in the darkness every room seemed completely identical to every other room. Even when you took different turns, it seemed like you were running in one giant circle. Eventually, you collapsed onto the ground, exhausted. You laid there for a moment, battered and broken, before you once more heard whispers. Weakly, you hesitantly look up, only to see the same specter from before, rising from the floor.

The specter actually appeared to be one of the anthropomorphic animals! She looked like a jackal of some kind, with unkempt, ratty fur and glowing, savage eyes. Her teeth seemed terrifying large and sharp, and her maw was twisted into a snarl. She seemed more savage and primitive than the other anthros, as if her mind had been broken. She was stark naked, revealing her thin, seemingly emaciated form, her ribs clearly showing. Of course, the most notable thing about her was her incorporeal form. She was totally transparent, and didn’t seem to have any physical effect on the world, able to move through walls and floor with ease. You crawl backwards in terror as she shuffled towards on all fours. From the look on her face, she was a festering ball of rage. “Get… out…” she repeats, in that same spine-tingling voice.

“Damn it! I’m trying!” you scream getting up and sprinting away down the hallway. Whatever that thing was, she was definitely real… and pissed off! You can still hear snarling in the hallway behind you, but you couldn’t tell how close she was. You just had to keep running. Eventually, you run into a dead end, with two strange structures built into the haunted house; a maze of mirrors, and a huge life-sized recreation of what seemed to be a suburban house. You needed to hide in one… but which?
15533322112.title: The Phantom

1553332212.content: You decide to head east… only to find the path eastwards covered in shards of broken glass! Looks like the various stores around the narrow path have been torn apart by looters, leaving the concrete covered in debris. You were barefoot, and your ankle was already bleeding… you didn’t want to make it any worse. You’d much rather just take one of the routes around it. On your left was a restaurant that seemed to be themed after a victorian mansion; on your right, there seemed to be some sort of abandoned petting zoo. Either of which would bring you safely to the place you need to go… provided there’s not any dangers within them, of course.
1553332212.title: Head East

15533322121.content:
You stepped curiously in the abandoned restaurant. It seemed to be themed after a victorian manor. The only source of the dark, moody lighting was the candles strewn around the room, which were somehow still lit even though this place seemed to have been abandoned for weeks. As you walked around, you smelled wafts of a pungent, metallic smell. This, combines with the darkness, made you increasingly uncomfortable, and you stumbled through the dark trying to find an exit as fast as possible.

You search through the nooks and crannies of the building, but can’t make heads or tails of the exit. This place seemed a lot bigger on the inside than it looked on the outside. Soon, you couldn’t even find the entrance anymore It seemed to you like both doors had disappeared, trapping you inside the dark, maze-like manor. That wasn’t possible, of course; you must’ve been going mad, the darkness causing you to lose all sense of direction as you stumble blindly through the halls.

Eventually, you come to a dead end where you clearly remembered a door could once be found. You felt like the walls were closing in on you… like every moment you waited, the manor just got smaller and smaller. You turned around, panic seizing you, and just stood there, scanning the entire main floor of the manor for something of interest. It was only then you noticed a huge bat hanging from the ceiling.

The moment you notice it, it falls to the ground in front of you, landing on it’s feet. As she unfolds her wings, you realize it wasn’t just any bat; it was an anthro! She looked albino; clear white fur, with dark red eyes and wings. Her wings furled around her by a robe, lending a bit of modesty to her otherwise naked, voluptuous form. She flashed you a toothy grin as she sipped some strange, crimson red liquid from a wine glass. “Don’t be afraid, darling,” she said, seeing you backing slowly away. She had a soft, velvety voice, unlike any you’ve heard coming from an anthro. “I’m not like one of these savage brutes you’ll meet on the outside. I think you’ll find I have quite… human sensibilities.”

You stare at her in awe. Was she the one that’s been messing with your head in the manor -- making you see things that weren’t real? Still, you were too scared to even speak. Seeing the look on your face, the bat woman giggled, lifting up a wing and gesturing to one of the booths. “Come, sit. Let’s have a drink. Don’t be shy,” she smiled, her fangs showing. “I don’t bite.” You wanted to flee, but there was something strangely hypnotic about the woman’s voice, and you found yourself compelled to sit in the booth across from her.

She poured you a drink. It was unlike anything you’d ever seen before; some sort of swirling, purple concoction, with occasional dim flashes of light coming from within. “You humans are so neurotic,” she rolled her eyes, passing it over the table to you. “Here, darling. Try this. This should make you more… agreeable.” You didn’t trust the bat woman at all, and the drink didn’t seem particularly appealing, but… for some reason, you didn’t want to disobey the sound of the woman’s voice. You stared at the purple mixture. Maybe one little sip won’t hurt...
15533322121.title: The Vampire

155333221211.content:
Something about the woman’s voice was simply… hypnotic. You felt a primitive urge to do everything she says as best you can. You wouldn’t dare to disappoint her. Your hand shivers as you take the glass in your hand, closing your eyes as you bring it to your lips, trying to ignore the seemingly inedible purple substance. You had only intended to try it, but just as you started to take a sip, the bat grabbed your hand, holding it in place! While you weren’t paying attention, she had moved up beside you in the booth! You try to push against her with your other hand, but it was no good; the bat pinned you against your seat with both arms in a gentle fashion, like a mother making her child take their medicine. To keep yourself from choking, you had no choice but to gulp down the vile liquid, until she had finally poured the entire concoction down your throat. Once you had downed it completely, she let you go, and you coughed a fit as you pulled away from her. “There you go…” She smiled, patting you on the back as you coughed. “That wasn’t so bad, was it?”

“What…” You choke inbetween coughs, trying to get the vile taste out of your mouth. Already, you were feeling a strange tingling sensation going up your spine. “What was…”

“Now, just let all of your worries slip away…” She says, taking you into her arms. You try to struggle, only to realize that you were now almost too weak to move. The concoction was slowly paralyzing you! You were helpless to resist as the bat woman gently cuddled you against her, resting your head on her soft breasts like a pillow. “You’re safe with me now… and nothing else can harm you…” Her words were ostensibly reassuring, but the tone of her voice implied she had some darker intentions for you. Still, your mind was too foggy at this point to even question her. Your faculties were slowly failing you, as if parts of your brain were just shutting off. First went your ability to reason, then your senses began to blur, and soon you couldn’t decipher consciousness from unconsciousness. You cuddled comfortably against the bat, as if she was a giant bed, as you slowly faded.

But just before you go unconscious, you notice something interesting. You saw through the bat anthro’s facade -- when you look at her, you now see a regular human woman, with pale white skin, jet black hair and red eyes. For some reason, you get the sense that this is her true form. Before you can act on this knowledge, however, the last vestige of your consciousness slips away.

.

..

…

….

…..

“Disciple… hear me…”

You knew right away that you were dreaming. Everything seemed so foggy… so impossible. But if this really was a dream, it was more vivid than any you’ve had in your life. You had found yourself floating high in the sky above your city, adrift in a vast, red void. Abstract shapes and figures appear and disappear in the sky all around you, and the wind seemed to whirl like a vortex, leading you up deeper into the void, farther from the city you called home. All the while, the woman’s booming voice beamed down from the heavens, like the decrees of some sort of bodies. “Yes. That’s it, human…” You felt a pain in your neck, as if two needles were penetrating your veins. What was she doing to you while you were unconscious? “Give yourself over to me. Your mind, your body…”

“What…?” You say, staring out over the void. You wince as the pain in your neck continues, and you rub at the spot with your hand. You turned up to the sky, literally communing with a goddess. “What is this? What’s happening?”

The booming voice paused. “You can… feel this…?” The voice asked, as if surprised. It was silent for a while. “Just be calm, human… this is the natural order of things…”

“What are you doing to me?” You ask, louder and more defiant.

“... I need… sustenance…” She says, and you finally put the pieces together in your head. She was drinking your blood while you were unconscious! Were you ever going to wake up? “A part of you will become... one with me.”

“You don’t have to do this,” you whimper, trying to figure a way out of this mess.

“I must,” the voice replied, remorseful. “I am… a creature of the night.”

You suddenly remember the vision you saw earlier. “No… you’re not…” You insist, your strength failing you. “You’re a… human… just like me…”

“What!? What are you saying?” The voice yelled in surprise, hurting your ears. It was silent for a while, before continuing in a sad whisper. “I… haven’t been human for… a long time.”

“You are human...” You say. “Deep down… you don’t want to do this…”

The voice tried to explain itself, but was unable to find the words. It sounded like she was growing increasingly frustrated, terrified by the knowledge that you might be right. “No! You’re wrong!” She suddenly yells with passion, and the vortex begins to spin with increased fury. “I am a monster, and you… are my prey. And you must be… consumed!” Suddenly, in your dream, the bat appeared before you; abstract in detail, of course, but you could still decipher her body as she poked her head through the void. The dream version of the vampire bat looked gigantic in comparison to you, and you could only watch in horror as you were slowly floated towards her massive maw, hanging open in anticipation. You didn’t know exactly what this meant for you, but you didn’t like it.

“No! You’re wrong! You’re human! You don’t want to hurt anyone!” You yelled, futilely kicking and screaming in the air as you floated closer and closer to the massive bat’s waiting, cavern-like throat. She remains silent as you find yourself drifting into her maw… and when she closed her jaws behind you, it sounded like the boom of thunder, sealing you in a pitch black void. You cry, floating in the fetal position in the darkness, unsure of what was happening to you. “You don’t want… to hurt anyone…”

.....

....

...

..

.


Eventually, the concoction wore off, and your surreal fever dream ended. You groaned, every inch of your body sore, as you sat up. You appeared to be on some kind of bed, in a bedroom lit deeply red. Your eyes had trouble adjusting to the light, as you tried to compose yourself and figure out what had just happened to you. You put two fingers to your neck, and sure enough, there they were. Bite marks. Just as you noticed that, you heard the bed creaking beside you. She was here! You turned to look at the vampire, only to realize she was...
155333221211.title: Fever Dream

15533322122.content:
You decide to head through the petting zoo, mostly for nostalgia’s sake. This used to be your favorite part of the park, when you were younger. Your favorite animal was always the she-wolf they’d keep near the back. She wasn’t very popular, as nobody was actually allowed to pet her, but you remember being enchanted by the wolf’s beautiful blue eyes. Of course, the crappy little zoo was empty now. At first, you assumed that all the animals had just escaped in the cataclysm… however, it wasn’t long before you noticed the blood on the floor, and the thick stench of death. You braced yourself for whatever you might see.

Ultimately, the petting zoo seemed desolate, but there were strange chunks of meat scattered around some of the pens, and what looked like scraps of flesh. You should probably have just left as soon as you could, but you were too curious to find out what had happened here. In the dead silence, you were able to clearly hear what sounded like a campfire burning, somewhere deeper in the complex. You froze, surprised. Somebody else was in here with you! Still, you couldn’t resist pushing onwards, deeper into the consuming shadows. Finally, sneaking through the darkness, you lay eyes on a makeshift campfire prepared in the middle of a concrete patch of floor.

Sitting next to the fire was a strange, malformed figure, cloaked in shadow. Even when your curiosity forced you to get a better look, you couldn’t quite tell what you were looking at. “Who… are you?” the figure said, her face shrouded in darkness. “Why are you staring at me?” You step back, a little shocked by her voice; it sounded like multiple people speaking all at once. The figure stood up, and from her silhouette in the darkness you can tell that she towered over you by a couple of feet. Finally, she shambled awkwardly into the light, and you finally got a look at her true form.

The anthro looked like an amalgamation of different species, with the bodyparts of various animals haphazardly sewn together; she had the hand of a feline, for example, attaching to an arm that looked like it belonged to a bear. This made the poor woman’s every movement seem difficult, as bits and pieces of her were threatening to fall off with every step. Her breathing was coarse and labored, and she smelled very strongly of rot. Her original head, at least, seemed intact; she had the surprisingly beautiful face of a wolf, with sad, glowing eyes. It was the she-wolf! “Why… do you keep… staring at me…?” she managed to say, in that spine-chilling voice. It was apparently difficult for the poor former wolfess to even speak. “You think I’m… hideous, don’t you?”

From the expression on her face, she looked like she was on the verge of tears, if indeed she was even capable of crying anymore. “You’re… just like everyone else…” she says, sounding like her sadness was quickly turning into anger as she slowly shambled towards you. You were frozen in place by a mixture of shock and fear. You had never seen anything like this before! Whatever was happening here, though, you had to act fast...
15533322122.title: The Zombie

choices: Try talking her out of it
155333221221.content:
“N-no!” you yell out on instinct. You tried you tried to ignore her current body; focusing only her pure, blue eyes. “I think you’re… beautiful…”

“W-what?” she gasps, shocked enough to slow her down for a second; but only a second. Her face instantly goes cold again, her happiness bogged down by her cynicism. “... you’re lying.”

“I wouldn't lie to you! When you were a normal wolf, you used to be my favorite part of the whole park,” you insist. “I-I always used to sneak you treats, remember?” You laugh nervously, trying to stand your ground as she grows closer and closer.

She stops in front of you, holding out an arm, and for a moment, you think she’s about to attack you where you stand. Instead, however, she collapses weakly into your arms, sobbing. Trying to ignore the rotting smell, you wrap the poor, zombified wolfess in a hug, rubbing a comforting hand along her back. “... oh God… I remember…” she said through her tears of joy, confirming that she can cry, at least. “... that was… so long ago.”

You hold her in silence for a while, trying to comfort her as she cried, ignoring the bits of flesh that now stained your shirt. You’ve seen some pretty crazy things since the cataclysm, but this took the cake. Eventually, she mostly regained her composure, and stumbled out of your grasp. You stand there for a second, getting a good look at the mess of fur of limbs. “What happened here? How did you…?” you ask, both baffled and sickened by what you were witnessing in equal measures.

The wolfess sighed, her blue eyes looking down at the ground. “... after we died, we were… brought back. All twisted together,” she started to explain. Was this… thing, really just an amalgamation of all the animals you used to love when you were a child? “All the other animals... they’re part of me now. Bits and pieces of them. I can hear them in my head…” She cups a hand over her forehead, as if she had a migraine. It suddenly makes sense that her speech seems so labored -- she has to control half a dozen different voices at once.

That at least explains why all the different parts of her body seemed to have different colored fur, but you were still baffled. You knew the aliens had some serious technology… but this seems closer to magic! There had to be something strange going on here. “You’ve been here all this time?” you said, remembering how long it’s been. Has the poor wolfess been all alone in the darkness, all this time? “We need to get you out of here. Find somebody that can help.”

She closed her eyes, seemingly frustrated by your advice. “... you don’t understand. We can’t leave…” she said, angered by your lack of understanding. “... we’ve been so alone here, but... it’s different now! Y-you can stay here, with us!” Her voice was starting to sound more desperate, now; and you noticed the undead wolfess slowly pull you closer and closer to her. You didn’t whether to feel sorry for or terrified by the undead creature.

“What? No, no, I can’t stay here,” you said, starting to feel like this was becoming more dangerous than it was worth. “Once I get my ankle fixed, I-I need to find a way out of the park. I need to fix the city.”

“You can’t! Don’t you… get it? Nobody can leave this place,” she said, tears in her eyes once again. “It will break you down… bit by bit… until there’s nothing left. You can’t stop it.” She was holding you so closely, you almost couldn’t move. “But you can… give in now. You can… become a part of me…”

“What are you talking about?” you cried, confused and terrified. You tried to pull away from her, but she maintained her supernaturally strong grip. “Let go of me!”

“It’s okay… this is the only way we can keep you safe…” Multiple voices spoke at once, as her eyes were glowing brighter. “You just have to… join us...” She didn’t seem to be malicious, but you didn’t want to know what ‘join us’ meant. You had to escape from her grasp somehow, but she seemed impossibly strong...
155333221221.title: Join Us

155333222.content:
You finally limp out of the familiar front gates of the amusement park, satisfied, the wound on your ankle seeming to have healed. Your surrounding are still silent, but now, the effect was more relaxing than it was eerie. You walked down the street, watching the beautiful skyline shine beneath the starry sky. It was so beautiful that, for a moment, you could almost forget the cataclysm you had gone through.

Still, you couldn't relax for long. The sun had long set, and around here, the night was perhaps even more dangerous than the day. You had to find a safe place to sleep. Unfortunately, instead of running across a hotel or whatever, you had found yourself on the coastline, stretching up and down the shore for miles and miles. You could sleep on the beach, you suppose. None of the anthros ever seem to go there, skittish as they were about the ocean. Then again, you remember there being a harbor nearby. Maybe you could go sleep in one of the boats? No one would find you there, and the concept almost seemed fun.
155333222.title: Exit the Park

1553332222.content:
You travelled down to the harbor, walking along the docks, admiring the boats stationed there. They were pretty, but most didnât seem like theyâd make a good place to rest. You were about to give up and settle with one of the smaller ships when you noticed a small houseboat bobbing right there in the water ▼
http://www.lakepowell.com/media/167216/v...
, completely unattended. It looked perfect! You jumped aboard without a second thought.

Just when you thought youâd reached the peak of your leak, you saw them -- the keys! They were right there in the ignition switches! You turn them a bit with your hands, analyzing them, as if you werenât sure they were real. You might finally have a vehicle! A boat, no less -- youâd probably be completely safe from the anthros out there on the ocean! You eagerly started flipped levers and turning switches, trying to get the boat to work. Eventually, you managed to lower the engines into the water, and with a pull of both ignition switches, they roared to laugh with a satisfying fervor! Afraid somebody mightâve heard, you quickly get a handle on the shipâs controls, maneuvering it away from the harbor as fast as you could.

âWoooohoho!â You half scream, half laugh, as you finally break out into open water. You were safe! You not only had a vehicle, you had a home; somewhere comfy and safe to sleep, out here on the ocean. Something told you youâd be using this baby for a long time. Maybe, once you saved the world, its former owner would even let you keep it. You chuckled at the thought, as you drove the vessel far enough out into the ocean that you would be far out of harmâs way, but close enough to the shore that the anchor would be able to reach the oceanâs surface. Once you finally found a spot you were comfortable with, you let down the anchor, and ventured deeper into the boat to get comfortable in your new home. The interior of the houseboat seemed like a cozy little place. A little cramped, yes, but at least the electricity still seemed to work. It had a tiny kitchen stocked with canned goods and a microwave, a comfy couch that could be pulled out into a bed, and even its own bathroom!

You lounged around on the couch for a while, your limbs still aching from having travelled all over town the previous day. Compared to sleeping in a dumpster, this boat was practically a paradise. Once you were rested, you dug through the drawers for new outfits, finally able to change out of the clothes youâve been wearing all week. After having a good, delicious meal of microwaved canned soup, you take a break on the back porch of the boat, looking at the city in its full glory. Youâd never seen any city so dark like this. Even at night, the cityscape was dominated by lights, but now the abandoned town seemed eerily black, like an abyss. Coupled with the night sky, it was beautiful, in a weird way. Finally, you pull out the bed and collapse down on it, feeling like youâre sinking into its comfy surface. The mattress did wonders to soothe your aching back, and you were almost immediately lured into the most relaxing sleep of your life.

That night, you dreamed of your family. You knew it was just a dream, but still, you promised them that you would find them for real some day. Soon, even the dreams faded, and only the soothing nothingness of unconsciousness remainedâ¦

âââ

You awoke with a start almost twelve hours later, only knocked arrive by the bump of a particularly large wave. Your restful sleep was chilled by the realization that the water seemed much harsher this morning then it did last night. You rushed to the deck, only to have your suspicions confirmed. No matter how desperately you looked, the shore was nowhere to be seen. The ocean stretched from horizon to horizon. You were stranded.

Suddenly, your little paradise on the sea seemed more like hell. Still, you tried to keep yourself calm. After everything youâve been through, you couldnât die now. After all, you couldnât strayed gone that far from the shore, could you? Your boat still worked. You just had to ride around, and youâd find your way back eventually. First, though, you had to assess the damage, starting with the anchor. You originally assumed that your anchor had somehow failed to make purchase, but in reality, it seemed something had torn straight through the line! Could some sort of creature had bitten it into two, you wonder? You shuddered at the thought of whatever animal was capable of such a thing. You also noticed a few dents and scratch marks on the bottom of your vessel, though those mightâve been there the entire time.

After some pondering, you decide to pick a direction based on the winds and currents, and then just stick with it. If it didnât lead you to the shore in a satisfying timeframe, you could just turn around and try the other way. You drove in as straight a line you could, your painfully slow ship cutting through the sea for over half and hour as you grew more and more anxious. At this point, you were certain you were going in the completely wrong direction.

Just as you were about to turn around, however, your paranoid eye notices something in the distance, almost over the horizon. You could hardly make it out from a distance, but it seemed to be some sort of giant...
1553332222.title: Stranded on the Sea

15533322221.content:
Your heart leaped in your chest with excitement as you saw a huge yacht approaching in the distance  . Could they be other survivors? They could be coming to rescue you!

As the ship grew closer, you noticed more and more disconcerting details. The yacht, once a luxury ship, seemed to have been painted, adorned with flags and torn up to resemble some sort of pirate ship. You were confused for a moment, but your heart sunk in your chest when you noticed there were anthros onboard! They were hanging all over the rigging and the starboard bow, waving their scimitars around threateningly. The shipâs loud, blaring horn sounded as it approached you, demanding that you surrender. Meanwhile, you had already rushed back to the wheel, and were trying to get the boat moving again. You didnât know the anthros had ships! Apparently you werenât safe even out here on the open ocean!

The yacht slowly caught up to you as you drove away, until your could hear the laughing and jeering of the crew. As the ship grew closer, you heard booming and whistling, as if fireworks were being shot off. You turned around to see flashing beacons of red being fired from the yacht, and bouncing off the water around your boat. They were firing flare guns at you! You try your best evasive maneuvers, but the onslaught of flares seemed endless; and soon enough, a lucky flare landed right on your shipâs engine, and your ears were rocked by the resulting explosion, causing you to fall out of your seat in terror. The anthros cheered, seeing they had disabled your vessel. You were helpless. You desperately crawled along the floor, trying to find something that could save you, but your luck had run out.

Your heart was thumping in your chest as you heard a rowboat approaching, and before you knew it, an anthropomorphic otter leaped on deck. You turned to look up at her, and in a crystalline instant, the two of you made eye contact. She was around seven feet tall, ridiculously voluptuous, covered in sleek furâ¦ the usual. There was something unusual about her, though. While most anthros seemed to go around naked, this one seemed to be dressed in aâ¦ skimpy pirate outfit? It looked like an expensive, particularly revealing halloween costume. You were distracted from her outfit, however, when the woman gave you a big, toothy smirk. Before you could crawl away, she lifted you up with ease, and tucked you away under her arm. You had never been this close to an anthro before! Her size and strength was terrifying!

The crew cheering triumphantly as the otter hopped off the ship with a captured male tucked under her arm, where another anthro was waiting on the rowboat. The otter laid you down on a seat, before lying on top of you, pinning you under her large, furry body as the two anthros rowed back to their ship. Eventually, she grabbed you by the back of your shirt and pulled you up the aft of the immense yacht. Finally, she tossed you on the deck of the ship, right in front of a jeering crowd of countless anthros.

You looked up at them, horrified. They were all female, as you expected, and all seemingly geared up like pirates. As you sat there on your hands and knees, coughing up seawater, a particularly powerful anthro woman walked up in front of you.

She was the biggest anthro youâd ever seenâ¦ about ten feet tall! She was over twice your size! She was dressed the most modestly of the bunch, donning a thick leather jacket, though it pushed up her cleavage, and she still went completely bottomless. She seemed to be some sort of wolf, and impossibly voluptuous; with breasts the size of your head and thighs that look like she could crush your skull between them. She wore a leather tri-fold hat on her head, sharkâs teeth in a necklace around her neck, and held a frighteningly huge scimitar slung over her shoulder. âWell, well, wellâ¦ what have we here?â She smirked, mocking you, pointing her scimitar in your face so you didnât dare move. âAnother damned landlubber TRESPASSINâ through Capân Lucyâs waters?â You wondered who âLucyâ was, until you realized that the wolf was referring to herself. This must be the captain!

âI-Iâm sorry,â was the only thing you could manage to say, not able to bring yourself to look the huge she-wolf in the eyes. The spectating pirates giggle at your pathetic display.

âSorry? You think youâre sorry? I have half a mind to gulp you down right nowâ¦ THEN youâd be sorry! But lucky for you, rogue men fetch a high price from the queen,â the she-wolf lets out a big, heart laugh, before gesturing away with her sword. âTake this scallywag to the brig! You can have fun with him on break, gals, but be gentle. Donât damage the goods, or Iâll be handing YOU over to the queen.â Two of the anthropomorphic pirates obediently rushed forward to grab you by both arms, giggling as they dragged you kicking and screaming into the ship.

âNo! Nooo!â You yelled, helpless against the anthros. You finally understood what was going on here. These âpiratesâ make their living capturing any rogue males that try to escape by sea, and sell them straight to the queen! They drag you down to the lowest chamber of the yacht, where a few of the guest rooms seemed to have been repurposed into prison cells. You were horrified to see other rogue men locked up in a few of the room where the doors were hanging open, tied to their beds or lying on the floor, looking injured. Eventually, they dragged you to a small room that resembled a hotel room, with everything stripped away except for the bed.

When they dragged you inside, you expected them to let you goâ¦ but to your surprise, the two women first pinned you against the wall of the room, sliding off your shirt. âHey! What are you doing?â You yell, wriggling futilely as they forcefully undress you.

âDonât you worry,â one of the anthros cackled as they pulled off your pants, eventually leaving you completely bare. You hid your head in your hands as the two anthros excitedly sized up your nude body. âWhile youâre here, you wonât be needing these.â Soon, the two of them took your discarded clothes and walked out of the room, slamming the door behind them. âSee ya later!â

You sat there, naked and humiliated, slumped against the wall as you pondered the situation you had found yourself in. You eventually try the door handle, only to confirm that, of course, it was locked from the outside, and no amount of force seemed to make it budge. You were trapped in the makeshift âbrigâ. After wallowing in your misery for a while, you notice your only boon is the portside window on the wall. You canât get it open -- it was screwed tight -- but it at least gave you a view of the ocean, which was as beautiful as always.

As you looked out on the seemingly endless sea, you contemplated the events of the morning. You didnât know what was going to happen to you. You just knew you were probably going to be here for a long, long time...
15533322221.title: Pirates!

choices: Agree, go with her for the night
Stay in the prison and withstand the onslaught
155333222211.content:
Just as you feared, the wolf captain’s demand was no idle threat. Things could get ‘lonely’ on the all-female vessel, and it seemed the plethora of rogue human males locked up in the brig were not just there for trading, but also present to let crew members ‘blow off steam’ during their off hours. It wasn’t long before you started getting visitors to your room, yourself. You weren’t particularly handsome or anything, but the horny anthros were eager to see if they could be the first to ‘break’ you.

When noon rolled around, quite a few of them skipped lunch just to ‘visit’ the freshly captured male. The first was the most memorable, mostly by virtue of being the first time you’d ever gotten intimate with one of the anthros. It was a surreal experience. She was much larger and stronger than you, the slim woman able to pin you to the bed with her weight alone, and her fur was unbelievably soft as she pressed you against her body, cuddling your head between her breasts as she straddled you. The exact details of the experience alluded you, but you remembered that she was a feline of some sort, and that her touch was surprisingly loving and intimate compared to the other crew members. She was content to just cuddle at first, even, gently grinding your shaft against her labia lips as she held you close, before gently sliding you into her. She moved painfully slowly as you shuddered against her, whispering into your ear as she edged you. But eventually, it was somebody else’s turn, and she was forced to hurry up and force you to climax inside of her. You felt violated at the time, but compared to those who came after, that experience was downright pleasant.

The next few women were interchangeable, but the worst was soon to come. A hippopotamus, you think she was, reeking of rum as she stumbled drunkenly into your room. You were terrified immediately upon seeing how ‘large’ she was. Not only was she slightly taller than the others, but being a hippo, she had quite a bit of blubber on her; she hardly fit through the door. Unlike the other visitors, who at least put in the effort to taunt you, the hippo didn’t seem to care about you in the slightest, focusing entirely on getting her release as quickly as possible. She tried riding your dick for a while, but this failed to satisfy her huge form, so she decided to ride your face instead. None of the anthros have showered in a week, that much was obvious -- but even among them, this hippo was particularly foul. The stench of her musk was, frankly, unbearable, but you were forced to eat her out as well as you could lest you be inadvertently smothered between her thick thighs. She was a loud one, too, adding to your embarrassment as she ground your face into her sex with increasing fervor. Worse still, she even passed gas a few times while you were down there; silently, so you didn’t realize what had happened until the smell crept on you. By the she had finally been satisfied, you were on the edge of your breaking point.

By the afternoon, when all the sailors had returned to their duties, you were still curled up in your now stained bed, shuddering in humiliation. If humans and anthros could interbreed, you’d probably have impregnated half a dozen women within that span of a couple hours. Both you and your mattress were covered in the foulest substances, and with no way to bathe, you were forced to ferment in the fetid detritus. Was this what your life was going to be like from now? Violated and toyed with constantly, until you’re finally sold to the queen, at which point, god knows what will happen to you? Your anxiety raised the longer you sat in silence… and by the time somebody else opened the door, you practically screamed, startled. A voluptuous violet-backed starling woman -- a bird with beautiful purple feathers -- stepped inside, though she didn’t seem to be as focused on you as the others. She was dressed in an old-fashioned white dress; while she was still voluptuous, she was at least much more modest than most of the other crewmembers. “Are… a-are you gonna…?” You stutter, backing away.

“What? Oh, no. Sorry, bucko, but you’re not my type,” she said nonchalantly as she stepped inside. You realize she was carrying a tray of food. It looked pretty standard -- toast, beans, starch, milk -- but for someone in your position, it seemed delicious. You shuddered as she gently placed the tray down on the bed beside you. “Just wanted to tell you it’s dinner time. Eat up, landlubber.” You stared at her, incredulous. Seeing that you didn’t trust her, she just shrugged and walked for the door.

“W-wait!” You yelled, trying to stop her before she left you there. She seemed like the only crewmember that has treated you with any modicum of sanity so far, so she might be your only hope. She turned to you, raising a brow. “I… I-I have some questions…”

She huffed and turned around, folding her arms, before finally nodding, deciding she had time to burn. “Ask away,” she said.

You tried to choose your words carefully, but your addled brain didn’t allow much in the way of that. “W-what’s going to happen to me?” You asked on a whim.

“You’re going to be in the brig for the next couple months while the ship looks for more captives. Then, the captain will hand you over to the mothership,” she said, rubbing her chin with her colorful wing. “If you behave, that is. If you don’t, she’ll probably just eat ya.”

You shudder at the thought. “So… for two months, everybody is gonna…?” You couldn’t even bring yourself to finish that sentence, but she seemed to understand what you meant.

“Why, yes. There’s only a few males left in the world, so most women around here can get pretty desperate,” she replied, only to frown when she saw the look on your face. “Oh, don’t look so glum! I’ve heard that every male we’ve had has learned to enjoy it eventually.” You have heard some of the men in the other rooms begging for more after one of the anthros ‘visited’ them, but you figured they had just gone mad.

“Do you… have any advice?” You ask, unable to think of any other questions.

She thought about it for a moment. “Hm… all I can say it, eat your dinner and hunker down,” she said. “‘Cause at night, most everybody’s off their shift, and half the crew comes down here.”

Half the crew, all back-to-back? Judging by the size of the vessel, that sound nightmarish! You felt light-headed with anxiety as you considered the thought. It was a long shot, but the bird might be your only chance. “Is… there…” You ask, paying careful attention to your wording. “Any way I could… a-avoid that…?”

She ponders the question. “Well, I could have the captain loan you to my private quarters from the night...” she suggested. “I was actually wondering how you managed to survive for so long out there. If you’re willing to tell me your tales, I’d be willing to give you a nicer place to sleep...” You hesitated. You didn't want to stay here all night, but... the grass isn't always greener on the other side. How do you know she's not trying to trick you into something even more dangerous? You didn't know exactly what this 'loaning' would entail...
155333222211.title: Held Prisoner!

choices: "I haven't been entirely truthful with you."
1553332222111.content:
“Y-yes, of course!” You nod, enthusiastically, surprised by the great deal. “Th-thank you, miss…”

“Call me Gabriel,” the avian woman smiled as she walked out the door. “See you tonight!” It slid shut behind her, sealing you in your prison cell once again. You chow down eagerly on your meal, as you consider the bird’s offer. Could she be trying to trick you? Could she genuinely just be friendly? At this point, it was too late to change your mind, anyway. You just had to wait and see how things panned out…

A few hours later, you were laying in bed, watching the sun go down anxiously. Night was approaching, and the bird was nowhere to be seen. Had she forgotten about you? Had her request been denied? Just as you were starting to give up hope, you heard somebody open your door. You turned, with a mix of excitement and terror, to see a canine lady peeking inside. “At attention, shrimp. Madame Gabriel has requested a private audience with ya.” The dog seemed surprised at your eagerness as you jumped out of bed to follow her, finally freed from the confines of the tiny room. Whichever anthros tried to visit you tonight would be left disappointed. She led you up to the higher floors of the ship, gesturing towards the door of one of the more luxurious suites. Whoever this ‘Gabriel’ is, she must be very influential indeed. “Have fun…”

You noticed the bird woman hanging out outside her suite, smoking from a pipe as she watches the sunset. She smiles as she sees you. “Ah, human,” she greets, only to be surprised when you run up and hug her around the waist. “Oh! Happy, are we?” You blushed, realizing you had gotten a little too eager as you pulled away.

“Sorry…” You said awkwardly, rubbing your arm. “It’s just… you saved me from those…”

“No need to apologize for a good-natured little hug, sweetheart. Please, come in,” she said, gesturing into her room with one of her wings. Her suite was amazing, adorned with very modern but snug furniture, sleek walls, and tall windows offering an incredible view of the ocean.

“Wow… it’s beautiful,” you say under your breath.

“Make yourself at home,” she smiles. “But don’t get too comfortable. You look like you could use a bath, first.” You chuckled in agreement, making sure not to sit down on any of this expensive furniture until you got cleaned off. The two of you make small talk for a while, before another visitor suddenly bursts into the suite. She seemed to a fox of some sort, and dressed even more revealingly than the other anthros -- almost naked. More notably, she was incredibly muscular, and looked like a fearsome warrior. “Oh, Eleanore!” Gabriel smiled, and gave the busy-looking vixen a peck on the lips. “How is the privateer business going, darling?”

“Terrible! They keep giving us the slip. They know these waters like the back of their paws,” the vixen says as she busily sorts through closets. She eventually happened to notice you. “... who is this?”

“Oh, that’s just a human that’ll be staying with us tonight,” Gabriel replied. “He’s going to be telling me all what life was like on the surface.”

Eleanore seemed confused for a moment, before smirking. “Oooh… I see,” she chuckled, before walking back for the door, diving equipment in hand. “Well, I’m just stopping by to get my gear. I might be doing a little swimming.”

“Good luck! Watch out from krakens!” Gabriel advised as the vixen disappeared onto the deck of the ship, and you couldn’t tell if she was joking. “Human, that was my mate, Eleanore. I recommend you treat her with the utmost respect. She can be more dangerous than she appears.”

You stare. “So you’re a…?” You ask, absentmindedly.

She stared at you, quizzically, before realizing what you were referring to. “A lesbian? Congratulations, detective, you cracked the case,” she giggled, and you felt foolish. You supposed you shouldn’t be surprised, but most of the anthros were so fanatically obsessed with males, you didn’t expect to meet one so wholly disinterested. Does this mean you could trust her more? You didn’t want to make any assumptions. Before you could respond, she sat down on a huge, fancy chair, looking like it had been made custom for her. “So! Down to brass tacks! How long have you been surviving on your own out there?” For the next few hours, Gabriel had you explain your past; both your time in human society, and your trials and tribulations after the cataclysm. She was a good listener, remaining mostly silent, nodding thoughtfully whenever you said anything interesting.

A few hours later, it was coming to be late at night. As things were wrapping up, it seemed like it was her time to speech. “Hmm. Fascinating tales,” she nodded approvingly with a smile, but her stature suddenly seemed more serious. “I’ve appreciated our conversations, but… there's something I want to apologize for.”
1553332222111.title: Meeting Eleanore and Gabriel

choices: Trust her and do what she says
Take her by surprise and fight back!
15533322221111.content:
You had, up until this point, enjoyed the bird’s company… but something about how she said that line made your freeze. “What do you mean?”

She sighed, as if she was about to discuss something difficult. “Well, I didn’t bring you here just so you could tell me your story. That was an innocent little lie by omission, you see,” she explained slowly, obviously choosing her words carefully so as not to alarm you. “In reality, part of the reason I bring humans up here is so we can have a… bit of harmless ‘fun’ with them.”

“What?” You stared the tall bird in horror, as she loomed over you in her chair. “B-but I thought you said you were…”

She waves dismissively. “Oh, nothing like that. It’s just, my darling Eleanore has some... unorthodox tastes, and I like to surprise her sometimes. You don’t need to worry about the specifics,” she said, as she leans back in her chair. “Just know that I’ll need you to… fill me up tonight.” She rubs her belly softly with a wing, making her intentions clear. Your heart sinks as you realize what she was planning on doing to you. You knew anthros were capable of swallowing people whole, and you’ve even witnessed it with your own eyes a few times. The possibility of being swallowed whole and alive, and slowly churned away by one of the fiendish women, had haunted your nightmares for days… and now here you were, the possibility all too real.

“W-what! No!” You yell, stumbling away from the bird. “You’re crazy!” You rush back to the door of her suite, and pull desperately on the doorknob, rattling it on its hinges but unable to pry it open. Eleanore had locked it from the outside.

Startled by your outbursts, Madame Gabriel stands, walking slowly towards you, trying to calm you down. “No need to freak out! I know you may not like the sound of it, but Eleanore is very adamant about this, so I’m afraid it is what it is,” she insisted, as if you were just overreacting. “We’re both adults here. Let’s act civil. After all, this is much better than what those other brutes would’ve done to you.”

You turn to the huge anthro approaching you, pressing yourself up against the door, trying to look for any avenue of escape. “H-how is this supposed to be any better!?” You yell, prepared to run right past her if she gets too close. “If you eat me, I’ll… I’ll…”

She realizes now, why you seemed so afraid. “Oh, heaven’s no! I’m a herbivore. My stomach can’t do anything to you!” She explains, and you flinch as she lays her wing reassuringly on your shoulder. “Trust me, I know what I’m doing. By tomorrow morning, I’ll be letting you out completely unharmed.” Her insistence gave you pause. She may have lied to you before, but this time, she sounds truly genuine. Besides, you don’t want to disagree with anybody so much larger than you, especially when she was close enough to destroy you at any moment. “You don’t even have to think of it as being eaten! Just imagine it as… being back in the womb! Doesn’t that sound relaxing?” She tried to make it sound fun, but only made it sound weirder.

“I… I-don’t know…” You say, staring at the floor, not wanting to outright say ‘no’, for fear that she might just stuff you down her gullet right here and now.

“Well, it’s going to happen either way,” she frowns, sounding genuinely apologetic, as if this really needed to happen. “I don’t want to have to resort to force, but I will if I must… but I’d much rather have you listen to reason.”

You knew you didn’t have any choice at this point. Holding back tears, you nod. “... o-okay…”

“Marvellous, then! Since you’re willing to submit peacefully, I promise I will make this as comfortable for you as I can,” she lets you go, walking back towards her chair. In the meantime, she points to one of the other rooms. “The bathroom’s right here. You should clean up a bit-- goodness knows where you’ve been! I’ll be with you in a moment.” You rush into the bathroom, and slam the door behind you, glad to finally be away from the huge avian. You turned the bathtub on to avoid suspicions, letting it run while you pace naked, back and forth, along the cold tile floors of the bathroom, contemplating your predicament. You didn’t really want to get swallowed by the bird no matter the circumstances, but if it was truly as harmless as she says it is, perhaps it wouldn’t be so bad. Then again, she’s proven she isn’t completely trustworthy. What’s to say this isn’t another “lie by omission”?

You couldn’t risk it. You had to find a way to escape. You found you could open the window in the bathroom, and it was even large enough for you to climb out of. Unfortunately, even if you did crawl out the window, there was nowhere for you to go. You didn’t want to accidentally fall into the freezing cold water this late at night; you’d never be found! You had to find another way out. “Human? What are you doing in there?” Gabriel calls, hearing the commotion as you search desperately for a way out.

“Nothing! Just… washing off!” You lie. You didn’t want to get caught trying to escape. She was acting ostensibly peaceful now, but if you provoked her, this might get ugly. Tired of feeling so afraid, you finally relent and climb into the tub, the warm water soothing your aching joints. You quickly clean all the dried and noxious fluids off your skin and out of your hair while you contemplate what you’d do when Gabriel walked through the door. Both options had their risks, and you knew one of the two would doom you… but you had to choose fast.
15533322221111.title: A Strange Request

15533322222.content:
Your heart sunk in your chest as you noticed a dorsal fin cutting through the water like a knife. It looked huge! You couldn’t help but be reminded of Jaws as the fin moved rapidly closer, whatever huge creature it was connected to obviously swimming straight for your boat. It looked like a megaladon! You quickly search your vessel for any weapons you could use against the giant shark, but couldn’t find anything of use. Panicking, you walk out onto the side of the ship again, trying to keep track of the creature’s movement. As you came closer, though, you realized that it wasn’t a shark at all -- it was an orca! You would be relieved, if the orca didn’t seem to be absolutely gigantic. It looked to be about forty feet long! The damn thing looked like a proper whale! You didn’t even know they could get that big!

You knew orcas never attacked humans, but with something of that size, you knew you couldn’t be too careful. You held your breath as it moved closer and closer… only to swim in another direction at the last second! Apparently, the animal must’ve been bluffing. You’re relieved, taking a moment to catch your breath… only to realize that the orca’s movements had kicked up a giant wave! The huge wave knocks your ship off balance, sending all your possessions flying around inside and nearly knocking you into the water! As you get your bearing again, you notice the dorsal fin approaching once more, building up another giant wave, swooping in for a second round. You realized what the whale was doing now… it was trying to knock you off your ship! Just before you could rush inside, the orca’s wave crashed into your vessel, sending you flying off the deck!

You’re paralyzed as you’re plunged headfirst into the ice cold ocean water. You open your eyes, only to vaguely see the giant orca circling around you from below, like a shark. This sight shook you back to your senses -- the whale had made its intentions very clear! You swim back up to the surface of the water, desperately getting your breath as you look around for your boat, your eyes still blurry. You realize that your houseboat had been knocked quite a few meters in the opposite direction. You were going to have to swim for it! You were almost sobbing as you swum through the freezing water as fast as you could, getting knocked around by the waves, knowing in your heart that the orca was moving closer and closer beneath you with every passing second.

Just as you were about to make it to salvation, you felt the orca’s lips wrap gently around your ankle, holding you in place. Before you could react, the giant whale dragged you under water with terrifying ease, plunging you into the bleak ocean from whence you may never return. You wriggle and scream futilely, all the oxygen leaving your lungs as you struggle, as the orca pulls more and more of your body into its mouth. Soon, your entire lower body was resting on its tongue, and you could only desperately punch at its snout with your hands, accomplishing nothing. The orca’s maw was so large, you were slipped inside easily, and before you knew it, you were plunged into darkness as the whale sealed its maw behind you.

You clenched your eyes shut, preparing for the end as you rested on its tongue… but instead of biting down, you felt the orca work your feet into its throat. In that moment, you remembered, to your horror, that orcas prefer to swallow their prey whole! You tried to grab onto its teeth, its tongue, anything… but they were too slippery, and you couldn’t resist the powerful grip of the orca’s throat muscles. It had obviously done this many times before, swallowing you down in a series of gulps, its throat working you down like a well-oiled machine. Just as your head was about to enter its throat, the orca opened its mouth, giving you one last view of the outside world… before gulping you down.

The confines of the orca’s throat squeezed tightly around your entire body, and for a while you were sure you were going to be crushed. You couldn’t move a muscle, your arms painfully pinned against your sides as the powerful muscles masticated you. Within its throat, seconds seemed to stretch by like hours… but eventually, you found your feet press through an even tighter sphincter. At this point, your lungs were burning from oxygen, and you were only half-conscious as you were forced painfully into the orca’s huge stomach. You gasp for breath as you were finally deposited into the animal's belly. Its stomach was filled with air, for some reason, so at least you could breathe even while the orca was underwater… but you weren’t sure if that was a blessing or curse.

The beast’s stomach felt like a sauna. It was surprisingly roomy, but the moisture and heat inside of her was unbelievably, and the walls churned and squeezed around you constantly. Your clothes had been lost somehow during your journey down its town, so you were literally naked inside its belly, increasing your feeling of powerlessness. There didn’t seem to be any acid yet, but you knew it was coming eventually. You sobbed, knowing you were doomed to be digested alive inside the huge creature. “Oh god…” You eventually cry out. “What did I do to deserve this…?”

“Whoa!” To your surprise, you hear a female voice respond from outside “You can talk?”

“Who said that?” You shout, wondering if someone was going to rescue you.

“Oh, it’s me!” The voice responded. “The… one who ate you, I guess.”

“Oh, great…” You groaned to yourself. The orca was speaking to you? This must be some kind of hallucination. “Now I’m hearing things.”

“Ohhh! This is so exciting!” The apparently talking orca squealed in delight. “I suddenly learned how to speak last week, but… I never had anyone to talk to!”

Your ears perked up. “Last week?” That’s exactly when those aliens invaded. Though it was probably just a hallucination, you decided to humor the voice. “What exactly happened last week?”

“Uh… well, I just woke up, and the sky was all green,” the feminine orca said, trying to recall the invasion. “And I was super big all of a sudden. And I could talk!” You ponder the situation for a moment. If the mothership landing could turn most animals into anthros, why wouldn’t it be able to make orcas talk? You realize that you’re actually in the belly of a giant, talking orca.

“So… am I stuck in here?” You ask, wondering if there was any chance of escape.

“Oh, don’t worry. You’re just in my forestomach right now,” the orca said, cheerfully. “I’m just storing you in there while I digest some fish I ate earlier. You’re not in my REAL stomach yet!” You remember that orcas have three ‘compartments’ in their stomachs, so to speak. The first one was relatively harmless… but if you got moved to her real stomach, you were doomed for sure. An orca’s digestive enzymes are some of the most powerful in the ocean.

“... yet?” You asked, frightened.

“Well, yeah. I mean, I did eat ya,” the orca replied, nonchalantly. “So you’re sorta food now! Just a few hours until you’re ready for my real belly!” She said this as if it was the most normal thing in the world, but you were terrified. The orca obviously didn’t realize that you didn’t want to be food; she just saw this as the natural order of things. You had to convince her to let you out somehow...
15533322222.title: Killer Whale!

info.brief_description: Save the town from a hypnotic skunk lady. But first, save yourself.
info.description:
It was a fine day in your city, when an alien ships lands. From that ship come a pack of green cats with absurdly long tails (twice their own height, http://www.furaffinity.net/view/20875621/ if you can't view this image because you don't have an FA account, you can email me and ask for the image), and there leader, a skunk lady with a tail just as absurdly long (http://www.furaffinity.net/view/20894122/ if you don't have an FA account, email me to request the image). Upon infiltrating the city, she starts spreading a pheromone gas that turns earthlings into her slaves. Males are ushered onto her ship while females are left to subdue any stragglers with flatulence. She seems to be able to affect everyone, except for a young male, you. As one of the only people unaffected by her pheromone gas, you have to find and neutralize the skunk lady. Or will you lose to her forces' gas?

As if the above weren't bad enough, a new species of cat ladies has appeared. The Juggernauts! These cat ladies look like ordinary ones, except twice their size and commonly wearing olive green lipstick.

1. No gore, bone or limb breaking. Also, no vomiting.

Amended2. Women are the only dominants. There can only be human males.

3. Dominants can be human or animal or alien (by which I mean those anthro animals that came in on the ship).

4. I will allow vore, but only if the predator isn't a human. I'll also allow shrinking, but remember, no gore.

5. No scat or watersports.

6. You may be subjected to more than just gas. Like I mentioned, I'll allow vore. I'll also allow sexual dominance.

7. All women have to be 18 or older

8. I'll also allow macro play. Or you can shrink the main character and have the dominator use their size to their advantage
